Adoptionist

Adoptionists reject the Holy Trinity, believing that Jesus Christ was adopted as God's son at his ascension, chosen because of his sinless devotion to the will of God. They do not revere the Holy Mary, and were declared a Christian heresy at the end of the 2nd Century.
Apostolic

Sometimes referred to as 'Gregorian', this was one of the early Christian faiths founded in Armenia by the Apostles Bartholomew and Thaddeus. It split from orthodox Christianity in the 6th century as a matter of Christology -- they are miaphysite, believing Christ to be of one incarnate nature, where both divine and human nature are united.\n§Y*§! Learned Apostolics may subscribe to the Alexandrite school of theology
Arian

Arianism is a nontrinitarian belief that asserts that Jesus Christ is a Son of God, created by God the Father, distinct from the Father and therefore subordinate to the Father. It denies that Jesus is God the Son. The Ecumenical First Council of Nicaea of 325 AD deemed it to be a heresy.
Haruri

The Haruri are a sect from the period of the Four Rightly-Guided Caliphs, named for their first leader, Habib ibn-Yazid al-Haruri. The Haruri were originally one branch of the Khariji 'Rejectors' movement, so called because they rejected Ali's right to the Caliphate.
Isma'ili

The Isma'ilis believe that, when the 6th Imam, Ja'far al-Sadiq died, his true successor was not Musa al-Kazim as the others believe, but in fact was the already dead Isma'il and his son Muhammad. The line of Isma'il has been in hiding for years, but now has emerged to reclaim the Caliphate.
Mahdite

The Mahdites believe that the messiah, or Mahdi, has already risen, and given his commandments that clarify the Qur'an such that no other interpretation is valid. They are led by their own Caliphate of successors to the Mahdi.
Mandaean

Mandaeism is a gnostic religion with a strongly dualistic worldview. Its adherents revere Adam, Abel, Seth, Enosh, Noah, Shem, Aram and especially John the Baptist, but reject Abraham, Moses and Jesus of Nazareth. It is represented in-game as an early form of Manichaeism, and a potential heresy should it resurface.

Manichaeism is a Gnostic religion founded by the prophet Mani, who was put to death by the Sassanid Shahanshah Bahram I in 277. His 'Religion of Light' incorporated elements of Christianity, Zoroastrianism, Buddhism and Gnosticism. At one point, Manichaeism spread far and wide, and was the biggest competitor with Christianity for replacing classical Paganism until it began to fade in the 6th century.

§Y*§! The Manichaean Archegos exists in the Old Gods and Charlemagne bookmarks, and may be restored later\n§Y*§! Manichaeans have their own holy festival, the Bema Feast\n§Y*§! Manichaeans may elect to dedicate themselves to a Shekhinah upon adulthood
Maronite

Beginning as a movement founded by the monk Maron in the fourth century, the Maronites are a Christian Church in full communion with the Holy See yet under the leadership of the Maronite Primate.\n§Y*§! Learned Maronites may subscribe to either the Antiochian or Alexandrite schools of theology

The Messalians, or Euchites ('Those who Pray'), are a heretical Christian sect that originated in Mesopotamia, influenced by dualistic faiths like Zoroastrianism. Messalians believe that God can be perceived by the carnal senses, and that this perception is necessary to reach perfection. Each person is born with an inner demon, and only intense prayer can drive it out. They also believe that Lucifer is the elder son of God and a force for good, and that incest is sacred since it was practised by the children of Adam and Eve. They have no formal rites and no strict church hierarchy.

Coptic

Copts are miaphysite, stressing that Christ had but a single nature, but of both human and divine character. This stance split them off from the main branch of Christianity after the Council of Chalcedon in 451. Though not viewed as outright heretics by Orthodox and Catholic Christians, it is a fine distinction. The nominal head of the Coptic Church is the Pope of Alexandria.
§Y*§! Copts may opt to become Desert Fathers and Desert Mothers instead of monks and nuns\n§Y*§! Learned Copts may subscribe to the Alexandrite school of theology
West Syriac

Syriac Orthodox Christians, also known as Jacobites after their founder Jacob Baradeus are Miaphysite Christians, stressing that Christ had but a single nature, but of both human and divine character. This stance split them off from the main branch of Christianity after the Council of Chalcedon in 451. Though not viewed as outright heretics by Orthodox and Catholic Christians, it is a fine distinction. The nominal head of the Syriac Orthodox Church is the Syriac Orthodox Patriarch of Antioch.

Monophysitism is an early Christian heresy which states that Christ had but a single nature. This is the opposite of the Nestorian position where Christ has two separate natures - one divine and one human. The nominal head of the Monophysite Church is the Monophysite Pope of Alexandria.
§Y*§! Monophysites may opt to become Desert Fathers and Desert Mothers instead of monks and nuns\n§Y*§! Learned Monophysites may subscribe to the Alexandrite school of theology
Nabawite

The Nabawites believe that the Qur'an was only the holy book for the Arabs, and that they have their own holy book and prophet, just as legitimate, sent by God for their people, modelled on Islam. They are led by a Malik, similar to the Muslim Caliph.

The Church of the East or East Syriac Christianity is a Christian branch which states that Christ has two separate natures - one divine and one human. This theological position was originally put forward from the Theological school of Edessa and had a powerful champion in the Patriarch of Constantinople, Nestorius, but was condemned as heresy in 431. The Church of the East never accepted this condemnation though and Westerners have since then for varying reasons applied the term Nestorian to the Church of the East. The nominal head of the Church of the East is the Patriarch of the East.
§Y*§! Learned East Syriac Christians may subscribe to the Antiochian school of theology

A true saint can only be created after one's death, but it is possible to embark upon that path while one is still alive. It is not an easy journey, requiring humility and a dedication to religious ideals, but success means that one will enjoy piety and recognition -- and perhaps a greater chance of beatification after one's passing. Failure, however, can mean a loss of piety and worse, and failure will be far more likely the more sinful traits one possesses.

Qarmati

The Qarmatians are a extreme splinter sect of Isma'ili Islam, and believe that there are seven ages of man, each with a new religion and prophet, and the final age is approaching. They believe that the rest of the Isma'ilis have lost the faith, and that Muhammad son of Isma'il is still in hiding, waiting to return as the Mahdi.
Tondrakian

Tondrakians are an anti-feudal, anti-church sect that originally flourished in Armenia between the 9th and 11th Century. They denied the immortality of the soul, the afterlife, and the rights of the church to rule over its fellow man. They supported property rights for peasants and equality between men and women.\n§Y*§! Learned Tondrakians may subscribe to the Alexandrite school of theology
Waqifite

The Waqifi believe that the Imamate has ended before the main branch of Shi'ism has accepted it. To the Waqifi, the final Imam is the Mahdi who will return at the end of days, and they wait faithfully for him.

Yazidis believe that God created the world and left seven angels in charge, the chief of whom is the Peacock Angel, Malek Taus or Shaytan, a being usually identified by Christians and Muslims as Satan.
column3: Les yézidis croient que Dieu a crée le monde et y a laissé sept anges pour l'administrer. Leur chef est l'ange-paon, Malek Taous ou Chaïtan : un être habituellement identifié par les chrétiens et les musulmans comme étant Satan.

column6: Los Yazidíes creen que Dios creó el mundo y dejó a siete ángeles al mando, liderados por el Ángel del Pavo Real, Malek Taus o Shaytan, un ser muchas veces identificado por los cristianos y musulmanes como Satán.

column2: Zaydi
The Zaydis are a Shi'a group that believe that the 'Alid Imams are not infallible, but are divinely inspired and have a responsibility to lead rebellion against corrupt authority.
Zurvanist

Zurvanism is a branch of Zoroastrianism that believes in the existence of Zurvan, a genderless god of of infinite time (and space), for whom there is no distinction between good and evil. Zurvan is the parent of the two opposites representing the good god, Ahura Mazda, and the evil Angra Mainyu, unlike normal Zoroastrianism, where Ahura Mazda is the Supreme Being. Zurvanism is further divided by its three schools of thought: Aesthetic, Fatalistic and Materialistic.

Wealth Sharing

One of Mazdak's primary teachings was that the [d_zoroastrian.GetFullName] oppressed its people, and hoarded its wealth. He believed that wealth should be shared, and espoused ideas of egalitarianism that were way ahead of his time. A ruler of proper faith should, by the [mazdaki.GetName] faith, set aside a large share of its taxes for the people -- and force their vassals to do the same.
No Wealth Sharing
There is no system of wealth sharing, just as it has always been.
None

The [mazdaki.GetName] nobility must put aside a token amount of wealth for the people -- more for show than anything substantial.
Minimal
Basic Wealth Sharing
The [mazdaki.GetName] nobility must put aside a portion of their wealth and taxes in order to subsidize the poorest of the poor.
Basic

A large amount of the taxes and wealth possessed by the nobility must go towards the people -- the building of shelters for the poor, the standard granting of gifts for the ill-favored, and the construction of hospitals for the sick.

Maximum Wealth Sharing

The portion of wealth and taxes which are set aside for the common people goes far beyond what even Mazdak would have thought possible. The people would be very happy under such a regime, feeling as if a large amount of the work they do for their rulers are returned to them in kind. The nobility, however, will be far less pleased.

column2: Changing caste is traditionally not possible. However, for a determined ruler who is willing to pay the price in gifts and bribes as well as risk the ire of [Root.Religion.GetName] society, even the impossible might be achieved. And after a generation or so, who knows, people might even forget that [Root.GetHerHis] family weren't always [EMF_SoldierCaste_Name]...\n\nA person of high learning will impress more and thus and have a lower cost in gold for the whole process.
column3: La tradition ne permet pas de changer de caste. Cependant, si un seigneur est prêt à en payer le prix sous forme de cadeaux et de pots-de-vin, et à risquer l'ire de la société [Root.Religion.GetName]e, même l'impossible peut se réaliser. Et après une génération environ, qui sait, on oubliera peut-être que sa famille n'a pas toujours été [EMF_SoldierCaste_Name]...\n\nUne personne à l'érudition élevée fera meilleure impression et devra dépenser moins d'or pour parvenir au même résultat.
column4: Traditionell ist der Wechsel der Kaste nicht möglich. Doch für einen entschlossenen Herrscher, der bereit ist, den Preis in Geschenken und Bestechungen zu zahlen und den Zorn der [Root.Religion.GetName]en Gesellschaft auf sich zu nehmen, ist nichts unmöglich. Nach einigen Generationen könnten die Leute vielleicht sogar vergessen, dass [Root.GetHerHis]e Familie nicht immer [EMF_SoldierCaste_Name] waren...\n\nEine Person mit hoher Bildung beeindruckt mehr und zahlt daher weniger Gold.
column6: Tradicionalmente, no es posible cambiar de casta. Sin embargo, un gobernante dispuesto a pagar el precio en regalos y sobornos, y a arriesgarse a enfurecer a la sociedad [Root.Religion.GetName], puede conseguir incluso lo imposible. Y tras una generación o dos, quién sabe, la gente puede llegar a olvidar que su familia no fue siempre [EMF_SoldierCaste_Name]...\n\nUna persona muy educada impresionará más y por lo tanto el proceso le costará menos oro.

Appoint [lollard.GetName] [d_lollard.GetRulerTitle]

A [lollard.GetName] ruler of high enough rank and esteem could gather the political will to elect a member of the [lollard.GetName] clergy as the leader of the faith. It would be a huge step forward in legitimizing the [lollard.GetName] faith as a true religion of its own, rather than simply a [catholic.GetName] upstart.
Appoint [messalian.GetName] [d_messalian.GetRulerTitle]

The Bishopric of Antioch is considered to be the highest title within the [messalian.GetName] hierarchy, and the bishop who holds it can be effectively annointed as the head of the entire [messalian.GetName] faith -- provided he or she has the backing of a sufficiently powerful [messalian.GetName] ruler, of course.
Become [muslim.GetGroupName] Mystic

While [christian.GetGroupName]s regard [muslim.GetGroupName] mysticism as sorcery or even worse, those esoteric scholars who attempt to study [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] and penetrate its many mysteries are well-regarded and welcome in almost every court. Many have dedicated their entire lives to such study, even to the detriment of their own health.
Become [muslim.GetGroupName] Poet

It is considered a noble achievement in [muslim.GetGroupName] society to pen [muslim.GetGroupName] poetry. Indeed, the greatest [muslim.GetGroupName] poets are counted as heroes equal to those of military generals and great scholars.
Become [paulician.GetName] [d_paulician.GetRulerTitle]

Only one who possesses sufficient prestige and [paulician.GetPietyName] can declare themselves leader of all [paulician.GetName] faithful, and that one will lead them against the rest of the heathens in this world.
Become [waldensian.GetName] [d_waldensian.GetRulerTitle]

Only one who possesses sufficient prestige and [waldensian.GetPietyName] can declare themselves leader of all [waldensian.GetName] faithful, and thus create a new church as an offshoot of the [waldensian.ParentReligion.GetName] faith rather than continuing an attempt to reform the old faith -- something which is an almost impossible task.
Begin Formalization of the [bogomilist.GetName] Faith

The formalization of the [bogomilist.GetName] faith into a structured organization supported by the state will take a great deal of work. It can be done slowly over time, or more quickly provided you have both the respect and [bogomilist.GetPietyName]. Either way, there are likely to be repercussions from those of the faithful who resist such changes.

Suppress the [paulician.GetName]s
The [paulician.GetName]s are becoming too much of a problem in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. It is time to deal with them once and for all.
Adopt an Heir

For many of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith, heirs cannot be acquired in the normal fashion. Thus it is quite acceptable for a ruler to adopt an orphaned [Root.Religion.GetName] child and raise it as their ownan act of generosity, if you will, towards someone who in any other circumstance would have few chances at a meaningful life.
Consolamentum

The only sacrament of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith, the Consolamentum represented a purification of the faithful from sins gained throughout their life. Once the ritual baptism had occurred, the faithful [Root.Religion.GetName] would be considered 'Perfect' and be expected to live a life of celibacy -- as well as to spread the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith further. Most did not receive Consolamentum until their deathbeds, but the zealous would take the sacrament much earlier.
Claim [d_ismaili.GetRulerTitle]

The descendants of Fatimah, daughter of Muhammad, hold a special place amongst those of the [ismaili.GetName] faith -- the head of the dynasty is considered the [d_ismaili.GetRulerTitle], and primary claimant to the [d_ismaili.GetFullName]. With no clear [d_ismaili.GetRulerTitle] currently existing, it falls on the head of the Fatimid dynasty to step forward and assume the responsibility.
Build the [Root.GetHouseOfWorshipCap] of St. Bogomil
Surely a faith which has come as far as the [bogomilist.GetName] one deserves a [Root.GetHouseOfWorship] to rival those of St. Peter's Basilica and the Hagia Sophia?

Annointing a [bogomilist.GetName] [d_bogomilist.GetRulerTitle] will mean true respect for the [bogomilist.GetName] faith as an independent religion, no longer treated as a heresy of [bogomilist.ParentReligion.GetName]. It will also stabilize the religion and mean that other benefits, such as claims and divorces, can now be provided by the [d_bogomilist.GetRulerTitle].
Create the [d_cathar.GetFullName]

A truly great ruler, dedicated to the cause of the [cathar.GetName]s and a true Perfectus, might be able to raise up a member of the faithful as a [d_cathar.GetRulerTitle]: a leader for the faithful everywhere, and able to direct his or her religion to spread throughout the known world.
Declare Kafir
Declare §Y[Root.GetBestName]§! to be §Ykafir§!, an apostate in violation of [From.Religion.GetHighGodName]'s laws.
Declare [Root.Religion.GetName] Emancipation

The [Root.Religion.GetName] faith is considered a heresy, but perhaps that need not be the case. With an officially-ordained head of our religion and a [Root.Religion.GetName] champion of sufficient esteem to sponsor a place for negotiations to take place, perhaps we could divorce ourselves from heresy and be treated as an offshoot from our parent religion instead... if they will let us go without a fight, that is. Doing so means giving up on any hope of supplanting them as the 'official' faith, but is that what we really want?
Donate money to the [d_army_light.GetName]
I can donate money to the [d_army_light.GetName] in exchange for [Root.Religion.GetPietyName] and lifelong respect from the [manichean.GetName] Church.
Donate money to the [d_army_lucifer.GetName]

Donate money to the [d_saint_blaise.GetName]
I can donate money to the [d_saint_blaise.GetName] in exchange for [Root.Religion.GetPietyName] and lifelong respect from the [apostolic.GetName] Church.
The Pact of Time

The coming of age ceremony for all [druze.GetName] adults, in it the [druze.GetName] signs the Charter known as the Mithaq Walley El-Zaman -- the 'Pact of Time Custodian'. The Charter embodies all human souls after death, allowing for their reincarnation in the next life.

A leader of enough [bogomilist.GetPietyName] and standing could force a formalization of the [bogomilist.GetName] faith far more quickly than would otherwise be possible. This will mean any repercussions from the faithful will happen immediately, but so will the reforms.
Formalize the [bogomilist.GetName] Faith

Enough work has been done to organize the [bogomilist.GetName] faith for it to now be considered to have a structure of its own. Note that this will mean that feudal lords will no longer be able to hold [Root.GetHouseOfWorship], and that [Root.GetHouseOfWorship] holders will be considered [bogomilist.GetName] bishops as elsewhere in the [bogomilist.GetGroupName] world.
Search for Omens
Study [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] in search of hidden truths about the future. Beware, for the omens could be good or bad, and the resulting effect on your mind could be devastating.
Study the Mysteries of the [Root.Religion.GetScriptureNameCap]

Scholarship and mysticism represent the highest levels of Muslim faith and achievement. A scholar should spend their life poring over [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName], unlocking its secrets and advancing their understanding of the universe -- even if doing so represents possible hazards such as blindness, insanity, or worse. Such risk is the price one must pay for enlightenment.

Now that you are without sin, or at least the appearance of such, you will be able to clear your name from the stain of apostasy and no longer be considered kafir by your fellow [kharijite.GetName]s.
Public Execution

Publicly execute §Y[Root.GetBestName]§!. You will receive prestige and [From.Religion.GetPietyName] for doing so, based on their rank and relative importance. Note that, while you may execute close relatives, you will lose prestige for doing so (though you will still gain [From.Religion.GetPietyName]).
Renounce Vows
As a [lollard.GetName], you are beholden to neither vows of chastity nor vows of religious service -- you may freely renounce both and rejoin the laity.

Revoke Religious Titles

If [Root.GetSheHe] is both [lollard.GetName] and doesn't have the Wicked Priest trait, §Y[From.GetBestName]§! will get a strong claim to all titles of higher than Baron tier.
Translate [Root.Religion.GetScriptureNameCap]

One of the ways the [k_papal_state.GetFullName] maintains its dominance over the common man is by ensuring that almost nobody can read [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName]. Perhaps the time has come to take the scripture out of the hands of the few and put it into the hands of the masses by ordering a translation of [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] into the vernacular. It would be an incredibly expensive proposition, and take years to complete, but it would be a terrible blow to [catholic.GetName] authority.
Choose a Shekhinah
A shekinah is the settling of the Divine Presence of [manichaen.GetHighGodName], representing a facet of [manichaen.GetName] worship which a member of the faith chooses to focus upon.
Create [d_manichaen.GetFullName]

The [manichaen.GetName] faith has been without a true leader for a long time. Now, with the fortunes of the faith having been restored due to your benevolent rule, it is time for a new Archegos to be raised up to lead the faithful into this brave new age.
Patronize Art

Religious artwork is important to the [manichean.GetName] faith. Mani himself was known as 'the Artist', and [manichean.GetName] rulers would donate their wealth to support the creation of new artistic works.
Create [d_mazdaki.GetFullName]

While Mazdak railed against the oppression of the [d_zoroastrian.GetFullName], now that his teachings have spread across all of [k_persia.GetName] perhaps the time has come to institue an organized priesthood of our own -- one that espouses the egalitarian principles upon which the [mazdaki.GetName] faith is founded.
Choose [mazdaki.GetName] Power

The [mazdaki.GetName] teach there are four Powers that bring Light into the World: Discernment, Understanding, Preservation, and Joy. Any adult member of the faith may embrace one of these Powers. in an attempt to achieve eventual perfection.
Abandon Prayers

The process of driving out one's demons is an exhausting process, perhaps even dangerous. While it would mean failure in the eyes of the Holy Spirit, perhaps it is best to put aside the prayers for a time and restore your strength before attempting them again.
Achieve Perfection

To one of the [messalian.GetName] faith, achieving perfection -- meaning one is free of the demons who bring with them mortal sin -- is the holiest state to which one can aspire. It means being one with [messalian.GetHighGodName], and will make the [messalian.GetName] a teacher of their fellow faithful. It also means that one is free of any obligations to mortal concepts of morality and constraint, as the idea of perfection is literal. If you are one with [messalian.GetHighGodName], how can you possibly sin? To achieve perfection requires a long period of prayer and fasting, and even then may not result in success unless the [messalian.GetName] is sufficiently pious and determined.
Castrate Yourself

Follow in the path of the Saint Sabas Apokopos, one of the founders of the [messalian.GetName] sect, and castrate yourself. In the eyes of the [messalian.GetName] faith, it is one of the most holy acts a follower is capable of -- though naturally it can only be done once.
Choose Patron Saint

The [messalian.GetName]s believe that there are four important patron saints that watch over them: Saint Nestor, Saint Adelphius, Saint Addai, and -- perhaps most shocking to other [messalian.GetGroupName]s -- Lucifer the Lightbringer. It is important that a [messalian.GetName] choose one of these patron saints to watch over them, and it will be the patron to whom they direct their daily prayers.
Expel Daemons

The [messalian.GetName]s believe that sins are literal demons that exist within the body, and that the only way to rid oneself of sin is to endure ritual fasting and rigorous prayer until the demons are forced out. This is the only way that one can achieve perfection and unity with [messalian.GetHighGodName], after which point all of one's obligations to morality and piety are considered irrelevant.
Join the Cult of Lucifer

A secret society among the [messalian.GetName]s that honors the Lightbringer as an agent of change. They seek to expose the secrets of Heaven and Hell, secrets they will keep for themselves. To most, however, it is a cult of machinations, where important secrets are exchanged amongst members for their own betterment.
Become Desert [Root.GetFatherMother]

Abdicate any titles you have and wander the desert as a religious ascetic -- becoming a Desert [Root.GetFatherMother] is a respected position amongst [coptic.GetName]s, and a tradition that has been ongoing since Saint Mark introduced the [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] faith to Egypt after the ascension of Christ.
Embrace Alexandrine School

Those of advanced learning in eastern churches tend to lean towards one of two schools of theology -- the Alexandrine School emphasizes the allergorical interpretation of scriptures, and tends to a more pragmatic approach towards the advancement of science and thought... even if that can lead to conflict with the zealous.
Embrace Antiochian School

Those of advanced learning in eastern churches tend to lean towards one of two schools of theology -- The Antiochan School leans toward a more literal interpretation of scriptures, and focuses more on tradition and the advancement of culture... even if that can lead to conflict with those of a more cynical or progressive view.
Observe Bema Feast

One of the most important religious observances of the [manichean.GetName] faith, the bema feast takes place annually at the vernal equinox. It is meant to celebrate the passion of Mani, and this year you have decided it shall be a feast to remember! Note that, if you enact the decision outside of the yearly timeframe in which the feast occurs, it won't actually begin until the equinox.
Found the [d_army_light.GetName]
Found the [d_army_light.GetName] holy order, in the name of the [manichean.GetName] faith.
Found the [d_army_lucifer.GetName]
Found the [d_army_lucifer.GetName] holy order, in the name of the [messalian.GetName] faith.
Organize [bogomilist.GetName] Faith
As a [bogomilist.GetName] feudal ruler of great respect and standing, you can lead the faithful to become more organized and respectful of the state's hierarchy.
Revive the [d_knights_saint_mark.GetName]
Revive the ancient holy order of the [d_knights_saint_mark.GetName]
Raise Zealots
Call on your fellow [Root.Religion.GetName] faithful to rise up and aid your just and holy war!
Restore Order to the Court
Perhaps it's not possible to salvage the authority of your throne. It might require a bloody purge of your court, and that will require you to be strong... very strong, indeed.
Vassalize [d_manichean.GetName] [d_manichean.GetRulerTitle]
It is only fitting that the [manichean.GetName] [d_manichean.GetRulerTitle] be a part of our realm. Perhaps enticing him with the offer of a temple at a holy site would help?
Vassalize [paulician.GetName] [d_paulician.GetRulerTitle]

As the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], you are perhaps the most prominent [paulician.GetName] ruler in the world. The [paulician.GetName] [d_paulician.GetRulerTitle] would undoubtedly gladly serve under you.
Vassalize Head of Religion

The leader of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith acts as a veritable exile -- without a [Root.GetHouseOfWorship] to call their own, a demesne from which to call out to the faithful, and without real legitimacy in the eyes of the world. We could offer that by granting a place within the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], something that would be of benefit to us all.
Give to the Poor
Every faithful [waldensian.GetName] ruler is expected to donate wealth to the poor people of their domain.
Choose [waldensian.GetName] Path
The [waldensian.GetName]s offer three different paths for their faithful to follow, each with their individual benefits and drawbacks.
Build Hospital

To better care for the poor, your councilors have advised building a hospital in [Root.Capital.GetName] to give proper medical care to the city. While it would be expensive to build and maintain, it would benefit the people enormously.
Celebrate Tawûsgeran

Tawûsgeran, also known as 'Circulation of the Peacock', is an important [yazidi.GetName] festival where Qewals and other religious dignitaries visit [yazidi.GetName] villages, bringing the senjaq, sacred images of a peacock made from brass symbolising Tawûsê Melek. These are venerated, taxes are collected from the pious, sermons are preached and holy water distributed.
[yazidi.GetName] Pilgrimage
Go on a pilgrimage that is of vital importance to the [yazidi.GetName] faithful: a voyage to visit the Tomb of Sheikh Adi ibn Musafir, and attend the Feast of the Assembly.
The infidels in [Root.GetName] are now a minority, and most people have embraced the [Root.Holder.TopLiege.Religion.GetName] faith!

column2: Your reputation as a formidable raider has spread even to faraway lands. People everywhere speak the name [Root.GetFirstName] in hushed tones, fearful that in doing so they might invoke you like a vengeful god and bring ruin down upon themselves.
Let them fear me!

There is renewed talk in the court of His Holiness, [Root.GetTitledName], of further [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] [Root.Religion.GetCrusadeName]s to retake the Holy Land and fight against the advances of [pagan.GetGroupName]s and heathens. Many are expecting His Holiness to issue a call to arms for the faithful any day now.

Rumors abound that there is renewed talk within the court of His Magnificence, [Root.GetTitledName], of issuing a call for another [Root.Religion.GetCrusadeName] to expand the Dar al-Islam. Righteous [Root.Religion.GetGroupName]s are preparing to join the ranks of the mujahideen should the call to arms be made.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] is upset with our law of Free Investiture. [From.GetSheHeCap] is asking us to change it to comply with [Root.Religion.GetName] Doctrine.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has been approached by the [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], and is clearly disregarding our lawful rights.
The [From.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] is asking us to replace our liege, and is giving us the divine right to do so.
[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] save the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] is a rebel and a traitor. The false sweet words of the false [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] has swayed [From.GetHerHim].
Your piety has been rewarded. [Root.RelHead.GetTitledName] has granted you the title of Apostle, and anointed you as one of the electors who shall choose [Root.RelHead.GetHerHis] successor.
Your piety has been rewarded. [Root.RelHead.GetTitledName] has granted you the title of Deacon, and anointed you as one of the electors who shall choose [Root.RelHead.GetHerHis] successor.
Your piety has been rewarded. [Root.RelHead.GetTitledName] has granted you the title of Stroinik, and anointed you as one of the electors who shall choose [Root.RelHead.GetHerHis] successor.
Your vassal [From.GetFirstName] was given a seat on the Council of Apostles.
Your vassal [From.GetFirstName] was given a seat on the Council of Perfecti.
Your vassal [From.GetFirstName] was given a seat on the Council of Advisors.
[From.GetFirstName] was given a seat on the Council of Apostles.
[From.GetFirstName] was given a seat on the Council of Perfecti.
[From.GetFirstName] was given a seat on the Council of Advisors.
My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has requested to join the [join_holy_order.GetName] in their struggle against the infidels, even though this will forever disinherit [From.GetHerHim].

My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has requested to join the [join_holy_order.GetName] in their struggle against the infidels. It is a dangerous adventure [From.GetSheHe] seeks, but [From.GetSheHe] appears determined.
Choosing the Shekhinah

The [manichean.GetName]s believed there were five 'Shekhinah', which are the elements where the Divine dwells. Each [manichean.GetName] can choose an element upon which to focus, and once chosen that focus cannot be changed.
I will focus upon Haunâ, or Reason.
I will focus upon Madde'â, or Mind.
I will focus upon Reyana, or Intelligence.
There are other Shekhinah to consider...
I will focus upon Mahíabtâ, or Thought.
I will focus upon Tar'îtâ, or Understanding.
The New [d_manichean.GetRulerTitle]

After the [manichean.GetName] [d_manichean.GetRulerTitle] was murdered by the [d_sunni.GetRulerTitle] in Baghdad, many thought that was the end of the religion as an organized church. But like a phoenix rising from its ashes, [new_manichean_leader.GetTitledName] has been proclaimed the new [d_manichean.GetRulerTitle] by [Root.GetTitledName], with the [manichean.GetName] faith having enough power now to make him no mere charlatan.
A glorious day!
And so the heresy grows more powerful...
The [d_army_light.GetFullName]

The growing power of the [manichean.GetName]s can no longer be denied. With the aid of [Root.GetTitledName], a group of fanatics, peasants, and madmen have now banded together to create their own army, to smite heathens and infidels and to protect the righteous. They call themselves the [d_army_light.GetFullName], and their holy mission is to fight for the cause of good -- in the eyes of the [manichean.GetName]s -- and drive darkness out of the world.
A glorious day!

My [Root.GetLordLady], this extremely generous donation will not be forgotten. You have my friendship, as well as that of the [manichean.GetName] Church. Rest assured that you will be rewarded in the afterlife, if not on Earth!
Yours in faith,

[From.GetTitledFirstName]

My [Root.GetLordLady], this antagonism is completely unwarranted! The [d_army_light.GetFullName] serves [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], but, one has to wonder, do you?

With anger and sadness,

[From.GetTitledFirstName]

Religious leaders from the province of Baghdad are complaining about the prevelance of [manichean.GetName] worshippers. 'It is horrible that you can not walk down a street in Baghdad without tripping over half a dozen [manichean.GetName]s. Why should we let these infidels continue to live while they tempt others away from the true faith?' They are asking that something be done, lest this become an even greater problem in the years to come.
We shall crush the [d_manichean.GetRulerTitle] and his followers!
No, I will not attack the innocent!
[manichean.GetName]s Slaughtered

The province of Baghdad was once the center of the [manichean.GetName] faith, home to [manichean_leader.GetTitledName] who is their leader. After complaints by [Root.Religion.GetName] worshippers, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has begun a slaughter of all [manichean.GetName]s in the region -- beginning with [manichean_leader.GetTitledFirstName] and so ravaging the population that the scholar Ibn al-Nadim reports only finding five remaining in the entire city after the pogrom was finished. The [manichaen.GetName] position of [d_manichean.GetRulerTitle] now lies empty, and looks to remain so.
An outrage!
So must it be.
After the battle is over, your soldiers hail the victory as a great triumph of the [d_army_light.GetFullName] over your foes, in service to the Army of Darkness.
[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] watches over us!
After the battle is over, your soldiers curse the defeat as a great triumph of the Army of Darkness over the [d_army_light.GetFullName], and shiver in their sleep.
It is the work of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName]!

You have begun preparations for the Bema Feast, to celebrate the life and death of the Prophet Mani. You send out messengers with invitations to your vassals, expecting all to come and honor [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
This year it will be very special!

Dear vassal,
I hereby invite you to attend the celebration of the Bema Feast at [From.Capital.GetName].

Your Liege,
[From.GetTitledName]
Of course I will go!
No, I will not attend.

My [Root.GetLordLady],
Alas, I will not be able to attend the Bema Feast. I will offer thanks to Mani in a much more humble affair at [From.Capital.GetName], but I do appreciate your invitation.

With sincerity,
[From.GetTitledName]
The nerve!
Guests have arrived from villages throughout the realm, to celebrate the Bema Feast in [Root.Capital.GetName]. The festivities are almost ready to begin!

Guests have arrived from villages throughout [Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName], to celebrate the Bema Feast in [Liege.Capital.GetName]. [Liege.GetTitledFirstName] greets you at the entrance to [Liege.GetHerHis] estate, and it seems the festivities are almost ready to begin!
The Bema Feast is over for now. Another celebration of Light to drive back the Darkness.
It is customary to fast in religious reflection before the start of the Bema Feast. Will you take part in this tradition?
I will fast for a week!
I will fast for the next three days!
Go without food? Perish the thought!
The Singing of Hymns

The Bema Feast starts with the singing of various hymns that celebrate the return of spring, the life and death of the Prophet Mani, and the battles the Forces of Light have won over the Armies of Darkness. All those gathered raise their voices to the gods, a chorus of faith and beauty that touches the soul.
This is my favorite part!
The Feast of the Elect

Only the Elect -- those who are devoted to the [manichean.GetName] faith -- are invited to take part in a ritual meal, which both symbolizes the life of Mani and the theology of the [manichean.GetName]s. To take part is a great honor.
Honor and Glory!
The Presentation of the Arzhang

The Arzhang, or Picture Book, is a work painted by Mani himself, which depicts the [manichean.GetName] theology in simple terms, so that even the uneducated can read and understand the faith. The book rests on the bema until the feast is over, after which a [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] recites sermons from it and absolves the sins of those attending.
Praise be to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!
The [persian.GetName] Uprising

It is said that the Abbasids would never have been able to seize the [d_sunni.GetFullName] without the aid of the great [persian.GetName] general, Abu Muslim, who in the end was rewarded for his service with death -- executed on the order of [d_sunni.GetRulerTitle] Al-Mansur. Resentment for this perceived betrayal has long simmered as resentment among the [persian.GetName] people, resentment which has now broken out in open rebellion. A peasant leader by the name of Babak, aided by his capable wife Banu, an effective general and archer in her own right, has risen up to free his nation from the unjust rule of [Root.GetTitledFirstName]... and has already attracted a massive following, enough to present a real threat to the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].
This is an outrage!
It's about time!
The [d_mazdaki.GetFullName]

Although the Prophet Mazdak always railed against the corruption of the [d_zoroastrian.GetFullName], and his followers have never had an official structure to speak of, now that the faith has risen to such prominence under [Root.GetTitledName] it seems the time has come to give it to them. With [new_mazdaki_leader.GetTitledFirstName] chosen as the new [new_mazdaki_leader.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] of the [new_mazdaki_leader.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], the [mazdaki.GetName] faith has entered a new era, with a priesthood rivalling that of the [zoroastrian.GetName]s from which they once stemmed... and have, perhaps, now exceeded.
A glorious day!

The [mazdaki.GetName] teach there are four Powers that bring Light into the World: Discernment, Understanding, Preservation, and Joy. Any adult member of the faith may embrace one of these Powers. in an attempt to achieve eventual perfection.
I choose the Power of Discernment.
I choose the Power of Understanding.
I choose the Power of Preservation.
I choose the Power of Joy.

You have begun preparations for the Tawûsgeran festival, also known as the 'Circulation of the Peacock'. You send out messengers with invitations to your [yazidi.GetName] vassals, expecting all to come and honor Melek Taus, greatest among the seven angels.
I've been looking forward to this!

[Root.GetTitledFirstName],

The time has come once again for us all to celebrate the Tawûsgeran, a time to honor Melek Taus - He who is most holy amongst the seven angels. The festival will take place in [From.Capital.GetName], and you are hereby formally invited to attend.
Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]

The Tawûsgeran festival is well under way when you finally arrive in [FromFrom.Capital.GetName]. [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitleCap]s walk throughout the crowds, giving out vials of holy water to the faithful. You can hear the holy rites to the Seven being chanted at shrines everywhere you walk, though the name of Melek Taus is most prominent amongst them.
An excellent time, to be sure.

Peasants are streaming into [Root.Capital.GetName] from all over [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] for the beginning of the Tawûsgeran festival, and already your vassals are arriving. The chanting of rites to Melek Taus can be heard from the many shrines at your window, and soon the true celebrations will begin.
The Circulation of the Peacock

The Circulation of the Peacock is about to start! In accordance with tradition, [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s and pious men carry the senjaq, statues of the Seven Archangels, in circles around the city as they distribute blessings. To carry one of the statues is an honor reserved for only those of great wisdom and [Root.Religion.GetPietyName], as well as an event requiring considerable strength and willpower.
I wish to carry one of the statues!
I am content to watch the proceedings.

As you carry the senjaq around, you discover that it is rather heavier than you expected. The unaccustomed weight causes you to stumble, and the idol slips out of your hands and crashes down to the ground and is damaged. Everyone stares in horror as you quickly pick it back up.
Only a few people saw that... right?

As you carry the heavy senjaq around, the weight and the heat begin to take their toll upon you. As if in a dream, you begin to hear the voices of the Seven Archangels talking, telling you secrets and mysteries...
They have visited me! I am blessed!
With each step of the Circulation, more and more of the truth of your faith is reveled to you. Of course this is the proper path. How could any man doubt such a truth?
For the glory of Menek Taus!

Perhaps it is the power of faith that fills you, but what once seemed so heavy at the beginning now feels as light as feather. Why, you could carry this senjaq around all day if the priests would let you!
Strength comes from faith!
Veneration of the Senjaq

After the senjaq have been paraded around the city, the populace of the city comes forward to present their sacrifices and tributes. You visit each senjaq in turn, praying for the wisdom of the Seven Archangels, venerating them with holy incense.
For Wisdom and Honor!
Gifts From the Pious

The final stage of the Tawûsgeran festival is the collection of alms from the pious. Every man and woman is expected to give, a contribution to the greater faith and in support of those in need. While most give only a few coins, those who are able are expected to give much more.
I am a pious [Root.GetManWoman]!
I will give what I must, no more.
Ignore this nonsense!

The final ceremony is a grand sermon of thanksgiving to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and his servants. It was a rousing sermon as always, and the crowd begins the feast with great abandon. Another glorious celebration of the Seven Archangels has been completed!
Praise the Seven!
The Tawûsgeran is over for now, and already the many decorations are being taken down. Melek Taus has been properly honored, and the realm is looking forward to a bright future under His wisdom.
Until next time!
Sadly, the death of [From.GetTitledFirstName] means the Circulation of the Peacock must be canceled.
Such is how it is.
A Koasasa is Discovered

The concept of metempsychosis, or rebirth, is central to the [yazidi.GetName] faith. Indeed, they believe it is possible for the Seven Archangels to be reborn among the faithful as 'koasasa'. Today it has been declared that [Root.GetTitledName] is none other than the koasasa of the Peacock Angel himself, Melek Taus. [yazidi.GetName] throughout the land celebrate this discovery, and everywhere the young man travels he is given offerings by those overjoyed by the angel's return to the mortal world.

The concept of metempsychosis, or rebirth, is central to the [yazidi.GetName] faith. Indeed, they believe it is possible for the Seven Archangels to be reborn among the faithful as 'koasasa'. Today it has been declared that [Root.GetTitledName] is none other than the koasasa of the Burning Angel of the Trumpet, Melek Israfel. [yazidi.GetName] throughout the land celebrate this discovery, and everywhere the young man travels he is given offerings by those overjoyed by the angel's return to the mortal world.

The concept of metempsychosis, or rebirth, is central to the [yazidi.GetName] faith. Indeed, they believe it is possible for the Seven Archangels to be reborn among the faithful as 'koasasa'. Today it has been declared that [Root.GetTitledName] is none other than the koasasa of the Angel of Death, Melek Azrael. [yazidi.GetName] throughout the land celebrate this discovery, and everywhere the young man travels he is given offerings by those overjoyed by the angel's return to the mortal world.

The concept of metempsychosis, or rebirth, is central to the [yazidi.GetName] faith. Indeed, they believe it is possible for the Seven Archangels to be reborn among the faithful as 'koasasa'. Today it has been declared that [Root.GetTitledName] is none other than the koasasa of the Commander of the Armies of [yazidi.GetHighGodName], Melek Mihael. [yazidi.GetName] throughout the land celebrate this discovery, and everywhere the young man travels he is given offerings by those overjoyed by the angel's return to the mortal world.

Today it has been declared that [Root.GetTitledName] is none other than the koasasa of the Great Angel, Melek Dardael. [yazidi.GetName] throughout the land celebrate this discovery, and everywhere the young man travels he is given offerings by those overjoyed by the angel's return to the mortal world.

The concept of metempsychosis, or rebirth, is central to the [yazidi.GetName] faith. Indeed, they believe it is possible for the Seven Archangels to be reborn among the faithful as 'koasasa'. Today it has been declared that [Root.GetTitledName] is none other than the koasasa of the Accuser and Destroyer, Melek Samael. [yazidi.GetName] throughout the land celebrate this discovery, and everywhere the young man travels he is given offerings by those overjoyed by the angel's return to the mortal world.

The concept of metempsychosis, or rebirth, is central to the [yazidi.GetName] faith. Indeed, they believe it is possible for the Seven Archangels to be reborn among the faithful as 'koasasa'. Today it has been declared that [Root.GetTitledName] is none other than the koasasa of the Great Angel, Melek Nurael. [yazidi.GetName] throughout the land celebrate this discovery, and everywhere the young man travels he is given offerings by those overjoyed by the angel's return to the mortal world.
I will do my best to live up to this honor!
A glorious day for us all!

The pilgrimage to Lalish, a site just outside of the bustling city of Mosul, is one of the most important journeys a [yazidi.GetName] can undertake. There one attends the Feast of the Assembly, and returns filled with the spirit and strength of the Seven Archangels... or so the story goes.

The day has come. Your belongings are packed, arrangements have been made for matters in [Root.Capital.GetName] to be attended to while you are away, and your departure has been kept quiet to prevent the unsavory from taking advantage of your solitary journey. Now you must begin your journey to Lalish.
Arrival at Lalish

You arrive in the bustling city of holy Mosul, and it is not long before you make your way to Lalish, a mountain valley village not far to the north. This sleepy place is where the [yazidi.GetName] faith truly began, and as the Feast of the Assembly unfolds, prayers offered to the Seven Archangels up in the heavens, you marvel at the conical roofs of Sheikh Adi ibn Musafir's tomb. The rest of your stay will be spent in Mosul, but you cannot help but feel overcome at having taken a path so many have walked before you.
Now, what to do next?
The [yazidi.GetName] Faith

There are many who claim the [yazidi.GetName] to be devil-worshippers, due to their veneration of the Peacock Angel they call Melek Taus or Shaytan. This has led the [yazidi.GetName] to be considered [muslim.GetGroupName] heretics for countless generations, even though their religion incorporates syncretic elements of not only the [muslim.GetGroupName] faith but also Gnosticism and the [zoroastrian.GetName] faith. Now, with [Root.GetTitledName] having risen to such power, [Root.GetSheHe] has declared the [yazidi.GetName] to be their own faith and no heresy -- and [Root.GetSheHe] has the prestige to be listened to. In the end, it may change nothing save to the [yazidi.GetName] themselves, but even so it is a sign as to just how far they have come since the ancient days of worshipping at hidden [Root.GetHouseOfWorship]s in the Kurdish foothills.
Praise to Melek Taus!
They are still devil-worshippers.
A New Reign

You are now the [Root.GetTitle] and, according to the tradition set by the 'Abbasids, may take a regnal name by which you shall henceforth be known, a name representing the virtues you seek to engender during your rule. Alternatively, you may break with tradition and keep your own name.
I shall keep my name!
I will choose a new name!
After a series of discussions with the wise men of your court, a number of options have been put forward for your consideration...
Actually, I DO prefer my original name...
I will be Al-Mustansir, [Root.GetSheHeCap] Who Asks For Help Against The Oppressor
I will be Al-Mustamsik, [Root.GetSheHeCap] Who Is Calm of Mind
I will be Al-Hakim, The Wise
I will be Al-Musta'sim, [Root.GetSheHeCap] Who Holds Fast In [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]
I will be Al-Zahir, The Helper Of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]
I will be Al-Nasir, The Victor For The Religion Of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]
I will be Al-Mustadi, [Root.GetSheHeCap] Who Seeks The Light In [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]
I will be Al-Mustanjid, [Root.GetSheHeCap] Who Asks For Help From [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]
I will be Al-Muqtafi, [Root.GetSheHeCap] Who Follows [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]
I will be Al-Rashid, The Rightly-Guided
I will be Al-Mustarshid, [Root.GetSheHeCap] Who Seeks Direction From [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]
I will be Al-Mustazhir, [Root.GetSheHeCap] Who Memorizes [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]
I will be Al-Muqtadi, [Root.GetSheHeCap] Who Follows [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]
I will be Al-Qa'im, [Root.GetSheHeCap] Who Carries Out The Command Of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]

[druze_founder.GetBestName] has vehemently disagreed with this view and has tried [druze_founder.GetHerHis] best to change the minds of [druze_founder.GetHerHis] followers, saying that [ismaili.GetHighGodName] is divine while [From.GetBestName] is merely human, but to no avail.
Yes, praise me! Praise [ismaili.GetHighGodName]!
Yes, praise me! Praise [GetHighGodName]!
Now that you mention it, I do share many qualities with [GetHighGodName]...
[druze_founder.GetBestName], what have you done?!
[From.GetBestName], what have you unleashed?!
Praise [GetHighGodName]!
The [druze.GetName] now consider §Y[From.GetFirstName]§! as their God
Your actions have proven you worthy of deeper initiation into the secret rites of the [druze.GetName]. It is considered a great honor to join this elite group of religious leaders.
I have been waiting for this!
I am not interested.
Oath of al-'Ahd

'I, [Root.GetTitledFirstName], being sane of spirit and body and duly qualified, attest on my soul, without compulsion or constraint, that I renounce all the different cults, religions, and creeds and acknowledge nothing other than obedience to our Lord [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], revered be his name, and obedience is worship, that in his worship I associate no past, present, or future being, that I commit my soul, my body, my property, and my offspring to our Lord [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] the guide of those who respond to the divine call and the avenger on the polytheists with the sword of our Lord.'\n\nWith those words, you have ascended to the rank of Initiate, and have now been given leave to study the [druze.GetName] manuscripts and attend the meetings of other Initiates, the true leaders of your faith.
In [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]'s name, I am ready.

Only the truest and most brilliant of the [druze.GetPriestTitle] become Ajawid, the highest religious authorities of the [druze.GetName] religion. Other Ajawid have sat in judgment of your abilities, and have found you duly worthy of joining them in discovering the Truth within the Hidden.
I take such a burden with the gravity it is due.
Rise of the [d_druze.GetRulerTitle]

With the ascendance of [Root.GetTitledName] to the rank of [d_druze.GetRulerTitle], the [druze.GetName] have been given an unprecedented spokes[Root.GetManWoman]. They are no longer the small and oft-maligned group of [druze.GetGroupName] heretics, but a force that has arrived on the world stage of equal worth to the religions around them.
A truly glorious day!
They are still heretics in the eyes of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!
Another [druze.GetGroupName] schism? Hardly a surprise.
The Rise of the [ismaili.GetName]

The schism at the heart of Islam dates back to its earliest days. The majority [sunni.GetName]s have long persecuted the followers of Isma'il, forcing them into hiding. The partisans of Ali look to his descendants for leadership, but they are forced to keep their ancestry secret. Now though, they are mobilizing their strength behind a young man by the name of [ismaili_revolter.GetFirstName] whom they claim to be Isma'il's rightful heir and [d_ismaili.GetRulerTitle]. Other [ismaili.GetGroupName] jurists claim the boy is clearly a fraud, but to his followers he is the one they have been waiting for and now they flock to his banner as he begins his [ismaili.GetCrusadeName] to wrest the [ismaili_revolt_target_title.GetFullName] from the hands of [ismaili_revolt_target.GetTitledFirstName].

The schism at the heart of Islam dates back to its earliest days. The majority [sunni.GetName]s have long persecuted the followers of Isma'il, forcing them into hiding. The partisans of Isma'il look to his descendants for leadership, but they are forced to keep their ancestry secret. Now, however, they are mobilizing their strength behind [d_ismaili.GetRulerTitle] [ismaili_revolter.GetFirstName] -- descendant of Muhummad through his daughter, Fatimah, who has abdicated his title as the [abdicated_title.GetRulerTitle] of [abdicated_title.GetName] in order to lead his faithful against [ismaili_revolt_target.GetTitledFirstName] for control over the [ismaili_revolt_target_title.GetFullName].

The schism at the heart of Islam dates back to its earliest days. The majority [sunni.GetName]s have long persecuted the followers of Isma'il, forcing them into hiding. The partisans of Isma'il look to his descendants for leadership, but they are forced to keep their ancestry secret. Now, however, they are mobilizing their strength behind [d_ismaili.GetRulerTitle] [ismaili_revolter.GetFirstName] -- descendant of Muhummad through his daughter, Fatimah, who has surfaced from relative obscurity to lead his faithful against [ismaili_revolt_target.GetTitledFirstName] for control over the [ismaili_revolt_target_title.GetFullName].

With your assumption of the [ismaili.GetFullNameName], [ismaili.GetName] faithful from across many realms have flocked to [Root.Capital.GetName] to fight under your banner. They believe that you will lead them to greatness, and that the might of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] cannot be ignored by any in the Muslim world.
A New [ismaili.GetName] Claimant

While the line descending directly from Isma'il, the Sixth [d_shiite.GetRulerTitle] of the [shiite.GetName]s, was thought to have been lost, a new claimant has arisen in the form of [Root.GetBestName]. While not a direct descendant, [Root.GetSheHe] is indeed a descendant of Fatimah and claims that is enough for [Root.GetHerHim] to carry the banner of the [ismaili.GetName]s. Many [ismaili.GetGroupName] scholars disagree, but there are a great many faithful who do and may one day flock to [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s banner.
Thank [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!
We are supposed to believe HE is an [d_shiite.GetRulerTitle]?
The [d_ismaili.GetFullName]

For many years, the [ismaili.GetName] [ismaili.GetGroupName]s believed that their [d_ismaili.GetRulerTitle] was in occultation, but now [Root.GetFirstName] has claimed not only to be the descendant of Isma'il but with his successful conquest of [conquered_title.GetName] has declared himself the [Root.RelHead.GetTitle] as well. Many of the [ismaili.GetName]s support his claim, while others support a leader by the name of Hamdan al-Qarmat who claims [Root.GetTitledFirstName] to be but an imposter. These 'Qarmatians' claim no allegiance to the new [Root.RelHead.GetTitle], saying he must be torn down at all costs.
Is my victory not enough? I have the support of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!
The [Root.RelHead.GetTitle] is the true descendant of Isma'il!
Hamdan al-Qarmat has the truth of it!
This is worrisome.
The [ismaili.GetName]s will tear themselves apart now?
More [ismaili.GetGroupName] schisms? This can only be good news!
Your liege, [From.GetTitledFirstName], has declared Hamdan al-Qarmat a heretic who must be silenced. It is time for you to decide whether you agree.

Your liege, [From.GetTitledFirstName], has declared his allegiance to [From.RelHead.GetTitledFirstName] and has stated that Hamdan al-Qarmat is a heretic who must be silenced. It is time for you to decide whether you agree.

Your liege, [From.GetTitledFirstName], has declared his allegiance to Hamdan al-Qarmat, openly declaring that he will not follow [Root.RelHead.GetTitledFirstName] and does not believe he is the descendant of Isma'il. It is time for you to decide whether you agree.

[Root.Educator.GetTitledFirstName] has spoken to you a great deal about the ideals behind the [cathar.GetName] faith, and how one who aspires to be closer to [cathar.GetHighGodName] must conduct themselves. [Root.Educator.GetHerHisCap] words have made a great impact upon you.
I will be a good [cathar.GetName], I think.

The [cathar.GetName] Church frowns upon contact with members of the opposite sex. Thus you are raised mostly among other [cathar.GetName] men, and rarely see girls your age at all. You start to feel strange urges, and it occurs to you that the church really only frowns upon reproduction...
It's technically not banned...

The [cathar.GetName] Church frowns upon contact with members of the opposite sex. Thus you are raised mostly among other [cathar.GetName] women, and rarely see boys your age at all. You start to feel strange urges, and it occurs to you that the church really only frowns upon reproduction...
A life of sinful urges is not something you can relegate yourself to. You are a devout [cathar.GetName], and that means that such sins are best put behind you.
For the glory of [cathar.GetHighGodName]!

After a long search, a young boy has been found who might make for an ideal candidate. Your councilors tell you he comes from an orphanage in [adopted_province.GetName], his parents both killed by a recent plague. Although a bit grimy and shy, you feel the child might make a good ruler one day, provided he is cleaned up and raised properly.
I suppose he will do.
The Council of [council_location.GetName]

A [cathar.GetName] heresy has been brewing for some time, begun by numerous ascetic [cathar.GetPriestTitle]s who espouse strange beliefs regarding there being two [cathar.GetHighGodName]s--a 'Good [cathar.GetHighGodName]' who created the spiritual realm, and an 'Evil [cathar.GetHighGodName]' who created the material realm and all of humanity, and the reason why all humans are filled with sin--but with the gathering of these [cathar.GetPriestTitle]s at a council in the province of [From.GetName], the heresy has begun to spread like wildfire. At this council, the [cathar.GetPriestTitle]s codified many of their laws and spread territories into 'bishoprics', and they have since gained many followers.
Another heresy? In MY lands?!
This heresy must be stopped!
They are led by a [bogomilist.GetName], I hear.
The Albigensian [cathar.GetCrusadeName]

The [cathar.GetName] faithful desire nothing more than peace, but the men of this evil world will not let that be. And so, a change in philosophy is in order. The [cathar.GetName] are now permitted, no required, to make holy war upon the unbelievers in order to drive them off and bring about the salvation of mankind.
So must it be
The [d_cathar.GetFullName]

The growing power of the [cathar.GetName] Church has led it to organize itself as a reflection of the [k_papal_state.GetFullName]. Created through the political will of [From.GetBestName], this new Church has a leader: [new_cathar_pope.GetTitledName], elected at a special gathering of bishops in [From.Capital.GetName]. The [cathar.GetName] world rejoices at the news!
Is this their idea of a [Root.RelHead.GetTitle]?
And so the [christian.GetGroupName] world devours itself.
Glory to Jesus!
[lollard_founder.GetFullName]

A discredited seminary student by the name of [lollard_founder.GetFullName] has been spending [lollard_founder.GetHerHis] time in [new_lollard_stronghold.GetName], preaching [lollard_founder.GetHerHis] heretical thoughts on [new_lollard_stronghold.Holder.TopLiege.Religion.GetScriptureName] to the peasants--specifically that the [new_lollard_stronghold.Holder.TopLiege.Religion.GetName] Church must be reformed. [lollard_founder.GetSheHeCap] speaks out against the greed and excess of [new_lollard_stronghold.Holder.TopLiege.Religion.GetName] [new_lollard_stronghold.Holder.TopLiege.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s, the Sacrament of the Eucharist, and the over-emphasis of reverence paid to [new_lollard_stronghold.Holder.TopLiege.Religion.GetGroupName] idols. Many peasants, having no love for the corrupt [new_lollard_stronghold.Holder.TopLiege.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s of [new_lollard_stronghold.Holder.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetName], have embraced [lollard_founder.GetHerHis] teachings and the [lollard.GetName] heresy is spreading like wildfire throughout the countryside.
Where is my [Root.GetLordSpiritualName]?
Terrible!
A wise [lollard_founder.GetManWoman] indeed!
Let the heathens fight each other.

As you men storm the [From.Owner.GetHouseOfWorship], they discover a rich cache of icons and relics, all of it gilded in gold and surely belonging to [From.Owner.GetTitledName]. Such greed and devotion to icons goes against everything the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith stands for... but this is still a holy place, is it not?
Destroy them, and take the gold!
I will not desecrate such beauty!
Translation of [Root.Religion.GetScriptureNameCap]

Several years ago, [Root.GetTitledName] ordered a translation of  [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] into the vernacular. The [Root.Religion.GetName]s believe, after all, that one of the way the [catholic.GetName] Church maintains control over the masses is by restricting those who can read it to those educated few versed in the ancient tongue of [latin.GetName]. A non-[latin.GetName] version of  [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] is, then, something of a revelation. Fortunately, [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s edition of [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] is considered to be a fine translation: clear, easy to read, and already quite popular with the common man.
Glory to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!
This is an affront to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!

Several years ago, [Root.GetTitledName] ordered a translation of [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] into the vernacular. The [Root.Religion.GetName]s believe, after all, that one of the way the [catholic.GetName] Church maintains control over the masses is by restricting those who can read it to those educated few versed in the ancient tongue of [latin.GetName]. A non-[latin.GetName] version of  [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] is, then, something of a revelation. Unfortunately for [Root.GetTitledFirstName], [Root.GetHerHis] new edition of [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] is not only considered something of a poor translation -- with far too many parts obviously swayed by the politics of the day -- it is mostly mocked outside of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] faith and mostly disregarded. Even so, it is of great interest to many, and has aided the spread of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith.
We will keep working on it.

The death of [From.GetTitledFirstName] means that [From.GetHerHis] efforts to translate  [From.Religion.GetScriptureName] into the vernacular have been put on hold. Not only that, they are in disarray, and it will take a fair amount of effort to continue the task. Alternatively, the plan could be stopped now, and at least some of the expense regained.
I will continue [From.GetHerHis] efforts.
[From.GetHerHisCap] dream dies with [From.GetHerHim].

[Root.GetTitledFirstName],
You are a holy [Root.GetManWoman], it is true... but you are also not a believer in the ideals we [From.Religion.GetName]s uphold. You revel in excess and greed, and thus I cannot allow you to retain your titles in [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. They are to be revoked at once, and given to a more worthy member of the clergy.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledFirstName],
I understand you espouse the [Root.Religion.GetName] ideals... yet I see no evidence of that in your conduct. You make a mockery of all we believe, and thus I cannot allow you to retain your titles in [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. They are to be revoked at once, and given to a more worthy member of the clergy.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledFirstName],
Since you are a [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] who understands the tenets of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith, you will see why I have come to the belief that you have gained far too many titles for your station. A good [Root.GetManWoman] of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] should attend to more simple matters. Thus I hereby declare that your greater titles be claimed by the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].

Signed,
[From.GetTitledFirstName]
So be it -- there is nothing to be done.
No! I will fight [From.GetHerHim], if I must!

My [Root.GetLordLady],
If that is what you have decided, then so must it be. My titles are yours.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

My [Root.GetLordLady],
If you truly feel that my greater titles are not suitable for a [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle], there is nothing I can do to stop your claim.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

My [Root.GetLordLady],
I will not bow down to the petty demands of a [GetFromRootInsult] [Root.GetManWoman] such as yourself, not now and not ever!

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
[From.GetSheHeCap] will regret that...
Brother Angelo

A disgruntled [Root.Religion.GetName] monk by the name of Brother Angelo has heavily criticized [Root.GetTitledName], and in so doing has rocked the authority of the [Root.Religion.GetName] Church. Brother Angelo denies that [Root.GetTitledFirstName] is legally the [Root.GetTitle], as [Root.GetSheHe] has abrogated the Rule of St. Francis -- which, according to his doctrine, represented the pure and simple Gospel. He has asserted that all of [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s decrees are thus invalid, and that all [Root.Religion.GetName]s who follow the [Root.GetTitle]'s will have lost the grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
The man is clearly a heretic!
He sounds like a man with the right ideas!
Criticize the [Root.GetTitle]? Unheard of!

The words of Brother Angelo have been weighing on your soul. Too many churchmen are more concerned more with power and money than with their holy calling, and the result is a [Root.Religion.GetName] Church that is rife with corruption. Perhaps the [fraticelli.GetName] are right?
I believe in their call for reform.
Right or not, I will follow the Faith.
The Poor of [poor_of_lyons.GetName]

A wealthy merchant of [poor_of_lyons.GetName] by the name of Pierre Valdes gave up all his earthly possessions and began wandering the countryside as a preacher after a brush with death. He has been condemning the [catholic.GetName] Church for its corruption, as well as calling for a return to a more Biblical lifestyle. The man has rapidly gained followers amongst the poor of [poor_of_lyons.GetName], and his disciples have ranged even further and begun seeking converts elsewhere -- enough to cause considerable concern within the [catholic.GetName] hierarchy.
The man is clearly a heretic!
And thus another heresy begins.
Another problem for the [catholic.GetName]s.

The founding of the [d_waldensian.GetFullName] was mostly underground, and the so the early initiates organized themselves into cells. The Doctores would lead the cells and train Novellani, who would go and preach to the masses, while the Sandaliati would travel to keep the cells in touch. It is a tradition that has continued to this day.
I am Sandaliati.
I am Doctores.
I am Novellani.

As a [waldensian.GetName] [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], you are considered to have brought considerable renown to the cause. What some might have disregarded as a passing thing is now given far more serious weight in the world, perhaps even enough to one day challenge the gravitas of the [catholic.RelHead.GetTitle] himself.
Lux Lucit in Tenebris!

As your men storm the church, you cut down a [From.Owner.Religion.GetName] [From.Owner.Religion.GetPriestTitle] trying to protect a relic, gilded in gold. These false idols are a means to deceive the peasants and confuse ignorant fools. You are of half a mind to destroy them and return the wealth to the people.
Do it!
I would rather keep it for myself.

Rome, the Eternal City, and the source of all the corruption of the Church. It is full of treasures stolen from the people, false relics to deceive the gullible. Your men have their orders: destroy them all, and return the wealth to the people.

Canterbury, where the tomb Thomas Beckett lies... or lied, since it is there no longer. The tomb has been destroyed by your holy wrath, no longer able to tempt poor Christian fools away from devoting their faith to false relics, and the wealth of its riches returned to the people.

You don't know who is buried in this shrine, but you know it is not St. James. That is just a false legend made to trick pilgrims and take their money. Well, no longer. You give the bones a proper burial, and then burn the shrine down around you. The wealth of its relics have been returned to the people.

In the Cathedral of Köln, there lies the Sarcophagus of the Magi: over two meters of gilded silver and jewels. Why waste such wealth on falsehoods, idols that lure the foolish away from their true faith in [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], when it could be given to the poor?
So must it be.
The Sacking of [FromFrom.GetName]

After the [waldensian.GetName]s seized Rome, they proceeded to destroy any and all holy relics they could reach, stripping all the wealth from the Roman churches. The bones of St. Peter have been thrown out and cast into the street, the Chains of St. Paul melted down, and the Scala Santa smashed and destroyed. [waldensian.GetGroupName]s everywhere are distraught.

Canterbury, the great pilgrimage site for all of the British Isles has been destroyed, the tomb of St. Thomas Beckett desecrated by the [waldensian.GetName]s. Even as the heretics rejoice at their victory, so are [waldensian.GetGroupName]s elsewhere distraught at the loss of the holy relics now cast aside as worthless.

The Way of St. James has no endpoint now, as Santiago de Compostela has fallen to the [waldensian.GetName]s. The shrine of St. James has been destroyed, the bones once therein now missing, and the many holy relics which belonged to the shrine have either been destroyed or cast to the people as trinkets.

The Grand Cathedral of Köln now smoulders as the [waldensian.GetName]s strip it of everything of value. Countless relics have been destroyed, including the Sarcophagus of the Magi: over two meters of gilded silver and jewels, all melted down. The [waldensian.GetName]s say that the poor shall be able to eat for a year on what was stored there.
Sacrilege!
A victory for sense and righteousness!

All [waldensian.GetName] lords are expect to give charity to the poor and disenfranchised in their realm. Now, that tenet is tested as a large number of refugees have arrived into [Root.Capital.GetName] from the provinces of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. The war has left them destitute, and their numbers have overwhelmed the ability of the city to support them.
They must be helped!
There is nothing to be done.
In the sermon today, your [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] expounded on the sin of greed, and how no greedy [Root.GetManWoman] can enter heaven. You just wish he didn't use yourself as an example.
He's not wrong...

A recent opportunity to improve the facilities in [Root.Capital.GetName] for assisting the poor has arisen, and it is something your councilors tell you will not only assist the people but make the city far better than it has ever been. It does, however, require a significant investment.
Then we must do it!
We cannot afford it.
The ideals of the [waldensian.GetName] faith have made a big impression on you. You have decided to be charitable at all times.
The poor need our help!

[messalian.GetName]s believe everyone is born with demons inside them, and those demons can only be expelled by intercession of the Holy Spirit... which can only be summoned with intense asceticism and prayer. It may take years to finally succeed, but you are ready to begin.
Let the demons be driven out, once and for all!
You have prayed and fasted for months on end, but despite all your efforts you are still haunted by the sins of the flesh. You are forced to give up in defeat.

You have prayed and fasted for months on end, but in the end you are forced to admit your mind is still not your own. If anything, the spells of lunacy have become worse as weakness and dizziness beset you, and there are nights were you wander through the castle, howling. The demons are too strong, and you are forced to admit defeat.

You have prayed and fasted for months on end, but in the end you are forced to admit your mind is still not your own. In fact, the visions come more frequently, now. Lucifer himself has been speaking with you, whispering of your lamentable weakness... and you have to admit you agree. The demons within you are simply too strong.

You have prayed and fasted for months on end, but in the end you are forced to admit that your attempts at mastering your soul have ended in failure. You are simply not pious enough, or not dedicated enough, or... you're not even certain. The demons still run rampant within you, unbidden.
I will try again, I swear it!
It has taken many, many months of prayer and cold baths, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Luxuria from your soul.
It has taken many, many months of prayer and painful dedication, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Gula from your soul.
It has taken many, many months of prayer and many painful donations to the poor, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Avaritia from your soul.
It has taken many, many months of prayer and far too many early morning exercises, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Acedia from your soul.
It has taken many, many months of prayer and more slow counts to ten than you can even recall, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Ira from your soul.
It has taken many, many months of prayer and a great deal of contemplative meditation, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Invidia from your soul.
It has taken many, many months of prayer and a great deal of contemplative meditation, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Superbia from your soul.
It has taken many, many months of prayer and far too many visits to the local orphanage, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Cruelty from your soul.

You almost thought this day would never come. After many, many months of prayer and meditation, you wake up one morning and... the voices in your head are simply gone. You cannot even remember a time when you felt so in control of yourself. The demon in your mind has finally been driven out!

You almost thought this day would never come. After many, many months of prayer and meditation, you wake up one morning and... your mind is simply your own. No more irrational impulses, no more dangerous thoughts. It is as if they simply never were. You cannot even remember a time when you felt so in control of yourself. The demon in your mind has finally been driven out!

You almost thought this day would never come. After many, many months of prayer and meditation, you wake up one morning and... you are pure. You know it, beyond the shadow of a doubt. Your demons are gone and you have been purged of sin, and now are in fact free from all sin. You have become a true master, the envy of all [messalian.GetName]s.
Finally, I am free!
Since you are no longer [messalian.GetName], there is no point in continuing the prayer and fasting. There are no demons within you to cast out.
While you would happily continue your ritual prayer and fasting, it is simply not possible to do so while you are imprisoned.
While you would happily continue your ritual prayer and fasting, such rigorousness is now simply beyond your capacity.

Despite your prayers, you are still haunted by lustful dreams at night. The craving for carnal pleasures feels as if it will overwhelm you at times. The demon within may be too strong for you to expel.
I will surround myself with those of my own gender, no-one else!
I cannot resist the temptation
The bold contours and muscles of the young men of your court are becoming irresistible. You realize you've been spending your days idly dreaming of their strong, oiled arms...
The soft scents of the young women of your court are becoming overpowering. A nice warm bath sounds nice, where you can can massage oil into one or two of their young, nubile bodies...
I must resist temptation!
I have no choice but to give in...
