You have never felt this hungry in your life. You think of all the food stored in your kitchens. All the prayer in the world won't help if you starve to death...
I cannot surrender to the sins of the flesh!

The sound of rattling dice draws you toward a pair of guardsmen, gambling for silver. It just so happens you have a set of loaded dice in your pocket, given to you from a friend in jest. Should you teach these fools a lesson?
No, gambling is sinful and greedy.
Perhaps just a few games won't hurt...
You haven't been keeping up on your prayers to expel the daemon of Sloth, which, beyond the irony of the situation, has been troubling you...
I will make a determined effort!
The prayers can wait until tomorrow.
A particularly irritating courtier has been on your nerves of late, when you happened to spot him prancing around with the most ridiculous hat on, causing your blood to boil.
Slowly count to ten...
Have that hat nailed to his head!

Your attempts to pray your envy away have been difficult. Lately, you have begun coveting a fine horse possessed by one of your courtiers, one who has been the pride of all [Root.Capital.GetName]. It would be so simple a matter for you to just take it for yourself. What could he do?
I can do without another horse!
It is rightfully mine, anyhow.
Your prayers to end your pride have not been successful. However, a young member of your [Root.GetHouseOfWorship] has proven himself skilled at exorcisms. Do you own up and ask for his assistance?
Humbly ask him for help.
No, that's ridiculous! What could he do?

A criminal is brought before you for justice, having been caught stealing a small breakfast roll from the market. Although you have been trying to end your cruel inclinations, letting this man go will reflect poorly on you... you do have a reputation to uphold, after all.
Let him go free.
Hang him as he deserves!
Choose a patron saint to watch over you and to who you will direct your prayers.
St. Nestorius, the Evangelist
St. Addai, disciple and healer
Lucifer, the greatest of the Archangels
St. Adelphius, the founder of the Faith

In a dark cellar, at the stroke of midnight, you take the oath. Surrounded by pentagrams, ram skulls and strange inscriptions written in no modern tongue, you swear to keep and preserve the secrets of Cult, and to die before revealing any of them. There, you learn the secret Truths of Heaven and Hell, passed down from Adelphius himself...
Better to reign in Hell...
The [d_army_lucifer.GetFullName]

The growing power of the [messalian.GetName]s can no longer be denied. With the aid of [Root.GetTitledName], a group of fanatics, peasants, and madmen have now banded together to create their own army -- one that has, much to the shock of [messalian.GetGroupName]s elsewhere in the world, taken as its patron saint none other than Lucifer the Lightbringer, greatest of the Archangels and the King of Hell. Lucifer, they believe, is no more than an agent of chaos and change, and in His name they intend to bring about a change in the world. They will drive the demons of sin from the ranks of humanity with the force of their arms... if they are given the chance, that is.
A glorious day!

My [Root.GetLordLady], this extremely generous donation will not be forgotten. You have my friendship, as well as that of all the [From.Religion.GetName] faithful. Rest assured that you will be rewarded in the afterlife, if not on Earth!
Yours in faith,

[From.GetTitledFirstName]

My [Root.GetLordLady], this antagonism is completely unwarranted! The [holy_order_name.GetName] serves [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], but, one has to wonder, do you?

With anger and sadness,

[From.GetTitledFirstName]

My [Root.GetLordLady],
I have thought long and hard about this, and I believe I have come to the conclusion that I must dedicate my life utterly to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. With your permission, I wish to join a monastery, though of course I will be available at court, should you need me.

With respect,
[From.GetTitledFirstName]

My [Root.GetLordLady],
I have thought long and hard about this, and I believe I have come to the conclusion that I must dedicate my life utterly to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. With your permission, I wish to join a nunnery, though of course I will be available at court, should you need me.

With respect,
[From.GetTitledFirstName]
The [d_saint_blaise.GetFullName]

In order the stem the tide of infidels and heretics bearing down upon the innocent faithful, a small army of [armenian.GetName] soldiers and clerics have banded together under the banner of [d_saint_blaise.GetFullName]. With the [latin.GetName]s and [greek.GetName]s pushing from the West and the [muslim.GetGroupName]s from the East, there is very little these men have aside from unshakeable faith in the power of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] to stand between them and their enemies.
True [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] knights!
The [d_knights_saint_mark.GetFullName]

In order the protect the oppressed faithful from the iron scepter of [muslim.GetGroupName] domination and the encroachment of the schismatics, the [d_knights_saint_mark] has arisen to preserve the [coptic.GetName] populations scattered throughout [k_egypt.GetName] and [k_abyssinia.GetName]. Tales abound of their courage and tenacity, even against innumerably greater odds.
The [d_lollard.GetFullName]

The growing power of the [lollard.GetName] faith has led it to organize itself as a reflection of the [k_papal_state.GetFullName]. Created through the political will of [From.GetBestName], this new Church has a leader: [new_lollard_primate.GetTitledName], elected at a special gathering of bishops in [From.Capital.GetName]. The [lollard.GetName] world rejoices at the news!
Is this their idea of a [catholic.RelHead.GetTitle]?
And so the [lollard.GetGroupName] world devours itself.
Glory to [lollard.GetHighGodName]!
The [d_waldensian.GetFullName]

[Root.GetTitledName] has claimed the title of the [d_waldensian.GetFullName], head of all [waldensian.GetGroupName]s who follow the teachings of Pierre Valdes and reject the greed and decadence of the [k_papal_state.GetFullName]. Others outside of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] claim the [Root.GetManWoman] is little more than a glorified scholar, but to the [waldensian.GetName] faithful [Root.GetSheHe] is a symbol of their victory against ignorance and attempts by their fellow Christians to suppress them. Perhaps, in time, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] will lead the [waldensian.GetName]s to claiming a piece of history in Europe.
A glorious day for us all!
Who is this upstart scholar?
A scholar [catholic.RelHead.GetTitle]? Now I've seen everything
The [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName] Conclave

The [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName] faith is considered heretical, but it would be foolish to ignore their growing power. A prominent [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName] ruler by the name of [sponsor.GetTitledName] has called for a conclave in [sponsor.Capital.GetName] where [heretic_relhead.GetTitledFirstName] and [parent_relhead.GetTitledFirstName] can meet and discuss whether a peaceful resolution of their differences is possible.
We are hoping for the best.
Peace with the [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName] heretics? Truly?

You arrive in [sponsor.Capital.GetName] and listen to [heretic_relhead.GetTitledFirstName] as [heretic_relhead.GetSheHe] goes on at length about the need for peace and the fundamental differences between the [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName] and your own... but what it comes down to is this: will you let them go, undermining the strength of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith in doing so? If you don't, you will need to marshal the [Root.Religion.GetName] faithful in a [Root.Religion.GetCrusadeName] against them... and failing that war would be far worse.
Agree to a peaceful resolution.
Refuse and call for the [Root.Religion.GetCrusadeName]!

In an unprecedented show of tolerance and diplomacy, [parent_relhead.GetTitledName] has agreed to a truce with [heretic_relhead.GetTitledName] and indeed the entire [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName] faith after a historic meeting in [sponsor.Capital.GetName]. The [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName]s will now be considered an offshoot of the [parent_relhead.Religion.GetName] religion, their differences a permanent schism, rather than a heresy which must be suppressed and stamped out. [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName] faithful across all of Europe have risen up in celebration of this momentous day.
[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] is with us!
We must tolerate these [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName]s now?
A sign of [parent_relhead.Religion.GetName] weakness, clearly.
This is all [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetGroupName] nonsense!

A historic meeting in [sponsor.Capital.GetName] between [heretic_relhead.GetTitledFirstName] and [parent_relhead.GetTitledFirstName] has ended in disaster. It was clear from the outset that [parent_relhead.GetTitledFirstName] was ready to compromise on none of the [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName] points of discussion, and eventually [parent_relhead.GetTitledFirstName] left the conclave in disgust. [parent_relhead.GetSheHeCap] shortly afterwards called for a holy war against the [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName]s by all [parent_relhead.Religion.GetName] faithful to reclaim their souls for [parent_relhead.Religion.GetHighGodName].
Did we truly expect any other result?
So be it!

My [Root.GetLordLady],
I have called on all [From.Religion.GetName] faithful to rise up in arms against the wicked [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName]s and strike down their most prominent leader: [sponsor.GetBestName]. I ask that you join the cause at once, and prove the [From.Religion.GetName] faith is the only true one.

In [From.Religion.GetHighGodName]'s name,
[From.GetBestName]
To arms!
I shall consider it.
Acheiropoieta

Above the gate to a city in [acheiropoieta_province.GetName], there is enshrined an Acheiropoieta: an icon which, it is claimed, was not created by human hands but rather came into existence miraculously. All icons in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are condemned to be destroyed, but the people of [acheiropoieta_province.GetName] have refused to destroy the Acheiropoieta, claiming its divine heritage shelters the city from danger. [iconoclast_patriarch.GetTitledName] has, however, demanded you deal it regardless.
Send soldiers to destroy it immediately!
Let them have their false icon.
Take it and keep it for yourself.

You still have the acheiropoieta you took so long ago from the city in [acheiropoieta_province.GetName]. You keep it in a secluded shrine that only you have access to. Lately, as you go to visit it, you hear voices in your head, telling you things, things confusing your mind...
It really is divine! Icons are real!
It is [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] trying to destroy me!
Constantine's Return

The war is not going well, and many parts of the empire are already in chaos. Now, a group of soldiers has reportedly broken into the imperial mausoleum in the Church of the Holy Apostles, opened the sarcophagus of Constantine V, and implored him to return and save the empire. Iconoclast zealots have been quick to jump on this news, claiming it is [orthodox.GetName] idolatry that is dooming the emperor. They have pleaded with [Root.GetTitledFirstName] to honor the memory of the former emperor and lead the emperor away from its idolatrous ways before it is too late.
They are right -- the idolatry must end!
That is not why we are losing the war!
This does not bode well...
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has embraced the iconoclast heresy, demanding that all holy icons be destroyed and all subjects of the empire convert as [From.GetSheHe] has.
Perhaps [From.GetSheHe] is right...
[From.GetSheHeCap] is a fool and a heretic!
Finally an [From.PrimaryTitle.GetTitledName] with sense!
This is of no concern to me.
[Root.GetTitledFirstName]

While the [paulician.GetName] faith has been riven by internal conflicts for the last few decades, the heresy has a new leader in [Root.GetTitledFirstName], a zealous [paulician.GetPriestTitle] of [Root.Culture.GetName] origin as well as an effective converter. He has spread his sect throughout Armenian lands ruled by the [e_byzantium.GetFullName], and is very quickly becoming a major problem for [orthodox.GetName] rulers.
Blasted heretics!

All across the Byzantine Empire, [paulician.GetName]s are being violently persecuted on the order of [Root.GetTitledName]. They are rounded up and imprisoned, their homes burned and their belongings seized. All [paulician.GetName] courtiers have been ordered either executed or banished.
Hopefully that will take care of it!
A rather extreme measure...
This is an outrage!
The [paulician.GetName] [d_paulician.GetRulerTitle]

[Root.GetTitledName] has claimed the title of [paulician.GetName] [d_paulician.GetRulerTitle], head of all [paulician.GetGroupName]s who follow the teachings of Paul of Samosata. Others outside of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] claim the [Root.GetManWoman] is little more than a glorified warlord, but to the [paulician.GetName] faithful [Root.GetSheHe] is a symbol of their victory against attempts by their fellow [paulician.GetGroupName]s to suppress them. Perhaps, in time, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] will lead the [paulician.GetName]s to claiming a piece of history in Europe.
A glorious day for us all!
Who is this upstart heretic?
A self-titled warmonger? How very [paulician.GetGroupName]...
[bogomilist.GetName]s in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]

A heresiarch by the name of 'Bogomil', which may not even be his true name, has appeared in the province of Kossovo, capitalizing on the anger of the locals following their conversion from pagan ways. His teachings of a heresy that seems to combine the [bogomilist.GetGroupName] faith with a combination of Gnostic dualism and anti-church sentiment has caught on extremely quickly in both Kossovo and the surrounding areas, presenting a challenge to [Root.GetTitledName]'s rule as well as to the authority of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. Some believe that this 'Bogomil' has reached the court of [Root.GetTitledFirstName], and that [Root.GetSheHe] might even be considered a conversion to these heretical beliefs.
I believe this priest has wise things to say.
Me, convert? To a foul heresy?!
Hurrah!
This does not bode well...

The formalization process of the [bogomilist.GetName] faith has officially begun, with [Root.GetTitledFirstName] meeting with a group of perfecti leaders in [Root.Capital.GetName] and expressing [Root.GetHerHis] desire to see the faith go from a disorganized movement to one fully integrated with [Root.GetHerHis] rule. They expressed doubt, but were willing to hear [Root.GetHerHim] out, for the time being.
We will all have to be patient.

All this talk of 'reforming' the [bogomilist.GetName] faith in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is pointless. Perhaps the previous rulers were interested in such a thing, but since you are not a [bogomilist.GetName], you will certainly have no part in it.
While you would gladly continue the process of reforming the [bogomilist.GetName] faith, you no longer have the influence to do so.

[Root.GetTitledName]'s tireless efforts to promote the transition of the [bogomilist.GetName] faith from a disorganized movement into a structured religion have been rewarded after a recent meeting of Perfecti in [Root.Capital.GetName]. They finally agreed to a common liturgy, so that ceremonies performed across [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] use a common set of prayers and rituals, and that this will be taught to new Perfecti going forward.

Up until now, [bogomilist.GetName] priests have all used different letters and gospels in their preaching, a result of the scattered and disparate beginnings of the faith. At the behest of [Root.GetTitledName], '[bogomilist.GetScriptureNameCap] of [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName]' has been written and agred upon as canon by a council of Perfecti in [Root.Capital.GetName].

In order to continue the process of formalizing the [bogomilist.GetName] faith, the scattered preachers and Perfecti will need to be gathered together in councils. They resist such efforts an organization, however, and the only way to see it done will be with coin -- for the poor, for shrines, for bribes, and for [bogomilist.GetHighGodName].
If that is what it takes, so be it!
I will not bribe my faith into reform!

[Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s tireless efforts to promote the transition of the [bogomilist.GetName] faith from a disorganized movement into a structured religion have been rewarded after an unprecedented agreement from [bogomilist.GetName] leaders across [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] to gather in permanent councils sponsored by the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle].
A good day for all [bogomilist.GetName]s!

A [bogomilist.GetName] Perfecti has approached you with an idea for continuing your efforts to formalize your faith: the construction of several seminary schools across [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], each teaching a common and unified version of [bogomilist.GetName] dogma to future preachers. It would be expensive, but the Perfecti says it would be a worthy achievement.
An excellent idea!
Not right now.

[Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s tireless efforts to promote the transition of the [bogomilist.GetName] faith from a disorganized movement into a structured religion have advanced, with the construction of numerous seminary schools across [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] that would each train new [bogomilist.GetPriestTitle]s in a standardized form of dogma.

[Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s tireless efforts to promote the transition of the [bogomilist.GetName] faith from a disorganized movement into a structured religion have been rewarded today after a prominent Perfecti in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] issued a proclamation of support. The [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] is a [Root.GetManWoman] of [bogomilist.GetHighGodName] and faith, he says, and thus [Root.GetHerHis] desires should be heeded.

[Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s tireless efforts to promote the transition of the [bogomilist.GetName] faith from a disorganized movement into a structured religion have advanced after the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] gave a speech in [Root.Capital.GetName] that has been widely-disseminated and complimented by pious scholars.

A recent treatise written by [Root.GetTitledName] [Root.GetHerHim]self on the vital importance of the [bogomilist.GetName] faith's continued reforms has spread far and wide across [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], and received a lot of recognition from the faithful as being full of wisdom. Indeed, some are viewing the text as a new addition to [bogomilist.GetName] canon.

Recently, a new sect of [bogomilist.GetName] has been spreading in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], one that advocates a radically different version of the faith. Normally this would not be an issue, as the sect is not popular, but it has proven disruptive to your efforts to formalize the [bogomilist.GetName] faith, as their presence has prompted other sects to follow suit.
Leave them be.
Quietly get rid of them.

A recent revival of [bogomilist.GetName] traditionalism has taken hold in [PrimaryTitle.GetName], with numerous preachers cropping up who actively deride your efforts to reform the faith as being exactly the same sort of tyrannical structure they rebelled against in the first place. Needless to say, this has not been helpful.

A prominent Perfecti in [demand_province.GetName] has publicly begged that you slow down, if not outright stop, the process of [bogomilist.GetName] reform. The common folk are confused by these contradictions, he says, and continuing down this path too quickly will only bring down [bogomilist.GetHighGodName]'s wrath. The Perfecti is too popular to be silenced, as doing so would turn him into a martyr for his cause.
Do as he asks, for now.
Ignore him.

A set of crop failures and other disasters that has fallen one of your provinces in recent months has stirred the ire of several fiery preaches in the area. They say that you are to blame, that your desire for reforms and general lack of piety is what has brought down [bogomilist.GetHighGodName]'s wrath upon the people of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. Sadly, their words have taken hold amongst many.

A prominent Perfecti has recently taken issue with your desire to reform the [bogomilist.GetName] faith, pointing out a number of flaws in your argument without ever actually saying outright that your intention is solely to grab power and force the faithful into compliance. To her, you are not a learned enough [Root.GetManWoman] to push such things forward, and there is no convincing her otherwise.

[Root.GetTitledName]'s recent victory against [From.GetTitledName] in [Root.Location.GetName] has been hailed as a major victory for the [bogomilist.GetName] faith, and has spread the notion that perhaps the continuing reforms of the faith have [bogomilist.GetHighGodName]'s favor after all.

[Root.GetTitledName]'s recent staggering loss against [From.GetTitledName] in [Root.Location.GetName] has been hailed as a sign that the ongoing reforms of the [bogomilist.GetName] faith do not have [bogomilist.GetHighGodName]'s favor after all.
[bogomilist.GetName] Faith Organized

In its inception, the [bogomilist.GetName] faith was only loosely organized. It didn't believe in formal [Root.GetHouseOfWorship]s, and opposed any kind of formal hierarchy -- this has all changed with the leadership of [Root.GetTitledName], whose [bogomilist.GetPietyName] and status as a Perfecti has encouraged all members of [Root.GetHerHis] faith to reconsider their resistance to feudal structures. [bogomilist.GetName]s across the world are now more formally organized, though many still do not consider them a true religion, and they remain opposed to any kind of formal church that emulates the [orthodox.GetName] priesthood. Even so, there are many that object to even these changes, saying that the [bogomilist.GetName] faith has betrayed its own roots at a powerful [Root.GetLordLady]'s behest.
A better day for us all!
[bogomilist.GetName] Faith Formalized

Though the faithful were hardly ready for it, the [bogomilist.GetName] faith has now been formalized as a structured religion thanks to the leadership of [Root.GetTitledName]. While many see [Root.GetHerHis] leadership and [bogomilist.GetPietyName] as being worthwhile to follow, there are many who claim [Root.GetSheHe] has dragged the faith too fast into something which too much resembles the very kind of tyrannical structures they once abandoned. Preachers throughout [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are questioning how far this will go, and whether the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] has not perhaps betrayed the [bogomilist.GetName] faith's principles for the sake of power. Whatever the case, [bogomilist.GetName] [bogomilist.GetPriestTitle]s are now unified under a common liturgy, a single sacred text, and operate out of [Root.GetHouseOfWorship]s -- far more than the disparate heretics from where they sprang.
This is how it must be.
Are we truly ready for this?

After a long and arduous process of reform, the [bogomilist.GetName] faith can now truly be considered a formal religion. Under the considered leadership and [bogomilist.GetPietyName] of [Root.GetTitledName], [bogomilist.GetName] priests are now unified under a common liturgy, a single sacred text, and operate out of temples -- far more than the disparate heretics from where they sprang. While some question whether these reforms betray the principles upon which the [bogomilist.GetName] faith was founded, far more say they were agreed to by all and with due consideration. The faith is now ready to come into its own.
The [bogomilist.GetName] Patriarchy

At the behest of [Root.GetTitledName], [new_bogomilist_patriarch.GetTitledName] has been elected as the head of the newly-founded [d_bogomilist.GetFullName], the [bogomilist.GetName] faith having completely transformed itself from an [orthodox.GetName] heresy into a fully-formed religion in its own right. [bogomilist.GetGroupName] leaders elsewhere have been forced to recognize this new faith as a force in its own right, and its inception as a schism from the standard [bogomilist.GetGroupName] faith rather than a true heresy.
It appears we must accept this now.
Heretics or not, they are still [bogomilist.GetGroupName]s!

Construction has begun in Tyrnovo on the planned [Root.GetHouseOfWorshipCap] of St. Bogomil, a structure to rival St. Peter's Basilica or the Hagia Sophia. It will surely be a marvel of construction, and a bastion of faith for all [bogomilist.GetName]s across the world!
Let us hope I live to see it finished.
The [Root.GetHouseOfWorshipCap] of St. Bogomil

As evidence of just how far the [bogomilist.GetName] faith has come, the [Root.GetHouseOfWorshipCap] of St. Bogomil has completed construction in the city of Tyrnovo. A majestic structure to rival even the most potent [bogomilist.GetGroupName] cathedrals, the [Root.GetHouseOfWorship] has become a bastion of faith for all [bogomilist.GetName]s across [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] and beyond.
St. Bogomil himself would be pleased!

Word of [new_martyr.GetFirstName]'s horrid death at the hands of the [martyr_killer.Religion.GetName], [martyr_killer.GetTitledName], has spread... and now you hear that [new_martyr.GetSheHe] has been declared a [new_martyr.Religion.GetName] martyr. [new_martyr.GetSheHeCap] died for [new_martyr.GetHerHis] faith, and so history shall record [new_martyr.GetHerHis] name and remember.
Our family is honored by [new_martyr.GetHerHis] sacrifice
The [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty is honored by [new_martyr.GetHerHis] sacrifice
The [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] is honored by [new_martyr.GetHerHis] sacrifice

Wonderful news! An envoy from [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledFirstName] has informed all members of the [new_saint.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty that the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstName] is to be formally declared a saint during a special ceremony in three months time. You have been invited to attend this solemn occasion.
[new_saint.GetSheHeCap] will be made a saint? Truly?
Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick]

In an elaborate ceremony conducted by [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledName], the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstName] has been formally recognized for [new_saint.GetHerHis] generous nature and piety and declared a [new_saint.Religion.GetName] saint. The faithful line the streets, listening to the hymns sung in the cathedral, and rejoice when the declaration is finally made: the [new_saint.GetManWoman] once known as [new_saint.GetTitledFirstName] will now and forever more be known as Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick].

In an elaborate ceremony conducted by [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledName], the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstName] has been formally recognized for [new_saint.GetHerHis] martyrdom and blessed sacrifice at the hands of [new_saint.Killer.Religion.GetName] infidels and thus has been declared a [new_saint.Religion.GetName] saint. The faithful line the streets, listening to the hymns sung in the cathedral, and rejoice when the declaration is finally made: the [new_saint.GetManWoman] once known as [new_saint.GetTitledFirstName] will now and forever more be known as Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick].

In an elaborate ceremony conducted by [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledName], the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstName] has been formally recognized for [new_saint.GetHerHis] strengthening of the [new_saint.Religion.GetName] faith and contributions to peace and thus has been declared a [new_saint.Religion.GetName] saint. The faithful line the streets, listening to the hymns sung in the cathedral, and rejoice when the declaration is finally made: the [new_saint.GetManWoman] once known as [new_saint.GetTitledFirstName] will now and forever more be known as Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick].

In an elaborate ceremony conducted by [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledName], the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstName] has been formally recognized for [new_saint.GetHerHis] tireless efforts to spread the [new_saint.Religion.GetName] faith amongst the heathens and thus has been declared a [new_saint.Religion.GetName] saint. The faithful line the streets, listening to the hymns sung in the cathedral, and rejoice when the declaration is finally made: the [new_saint.GetManWoman] once known as [new_saint.GetTitledFirstName] will now and forever more be known as Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick].

In an elaborate ceremony conducted by [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledName], the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstName] has been formally recognized for [new_saint.GetHerHis] conversion to the [new_saint.Religion.GetName] away from infidel beliefs and thus has been declared a [new_saint.Religion.GetName] saint. The faithful line the streets, listening to the hymns sung in the cathedral, and rejoice when the declaration is finally made: the [new_saint.GetManWoman] once known as [new_saint.GetTitledFirstName] will now and forever more be known as Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick].

In an elaborate ceremony conducted by [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledName], the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstName] has been formally recognized for [new_saint.GetHerHis] incredible piety, so much so that [new_saint.GetSheHe] was spoken to by the Son of [new_saint.Religion.GetHighGodName] Himself, and thus has been declared a [new_saint.Religion.GetName] saint. The faithful line the streets, listening to the hymns sung in the cathedral, and rejoice when the declaration is finally made: the [new_saint.GetManWoman] once known as [new_saint.GetTitledFirstName] will now and forever more be known as Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick].

In an elaborate ceremony conducted by [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledName], the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstName] has been formally recognized for [new_saint.GetHerHis] piety and the example [new_saint.GetSheHe] set as a true [new_saint.Religion.GetGroupName] knight, and thus has been declared a [new_saint.Religion.GetName] saint. The faithful line the streets, listening to the hymns sung in the cathedral, and rejoice when the declaration is finally made: the [new_saint.GetManWoman] once known as [new_saint.GetTitledFirstName] will now and forever more be known as Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick].

In an elaborate ceremony conducted by [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledName], the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstName] has been formally recognized for [new_saint.GetHerHis] leadership of the [new_saint.Religion.GetName] faithful as a true example of a [new_saint.Religion.GetGroupName], and thus has been declared a [new_saint.Religion.GetName] saint. The faithful line the streets, listening to the hymns sung in the cathedral, and rejoice when the declaration is finally made: the [new_saint.GetManWoman] once known as [new_saint.GetTitledFirstName] will now and forever more be known as Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick].
Glory to [new_saint.Religion.GetHighGodName]!

The path to becoming a paragon of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith is a difficult one, and will likely take years of dedication and patience before it is rewarded -- if, indeed, it is rewarded at all. There will be many setbacks along the way, and the purification of one's soul does not come without trial, but the truly faithful could perhaps see it through to the end.
I shall persevere!

With your wealth, it would not be difficult to build a [Root.Religion.GetName] [Root.GetHouseOfWorship] in [Root.Location.GetName], and the clergy would be very grateful. It would go a long way to showing your dedication to [Root.Religion.GetPietyName].
Yes, that's a wonderful idea!
No, there are enough [Root.GetHouseOfWorship]es.

The recent outbreak of a sickness in [Root.Location.GetName] brings to mind tales of saints who administered to the sick, doing whatever they can for the poor and helpless. Your advisors are alarmed, however, expressing their worry that exposing yourself to such illness is a very bad idea.
Of course I will help the sick!
They are right -- it's too risky.

Perhaps having heard of your efforts to treat the sick, a man riddled with disease has come to [Root.Location.GetName] asking that you lay on hands and pray to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] that he be cured. One so faithful as yourself, he claims, is his best and only hope.
I will touch him and pray.
No, healing doesn't work that way!

You've heard rumors of a wise ascetic monk living in a remote part of [Root.Location.GetName]. Perhaps if you undertake a journey to visit the man, he could impart his wisdom upon you. It would be a difficult voyage, however, far more so since you feel you must go it alone.
I will go at once!
No, it's not worth the risk.

True dedication to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith can not be done from a throne. If you are to be truly saintly, you must retreat to a monastery and take vows to serve [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and only Him.
I will live my life in the service of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!
No, I am meant for better things.
There are whispers in your court that one who has so much wealth cannot truly be considered humble or charitable, and that such dedication to the material world is hardly the sign of the saintly.
Wealth is unimportant to me!
What should I do? Give it all away?!

During your recent bout of illness, one of your maids is shocked to discover your hands bleeding -- as if you were suffering from the same wounds Jesus Christ suffered upon the cross. There is no evidence of the stigmata later, but the maid's tale has spread throughout [Root.Location.GetName] and many seem to believe it.
Perhaps I am truly blessed!

You hear that [supporting_priest.GetBestName] has declared [supporting_priest.GetHerHis] support for your quest to attain saintly status. [supporting_priest.GetHerHisCap] last sermon was dedicated to lauding your virtues, and suggesting the [Root.Religion.GetName] faithful should emulate you.

You hear that [doubting_priest.GetBestName] has been openly doubting your quest for saintly status, suggesting it is proud that motivates you and not true dedication to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. The only thing that could possibly persuade [doubting_priest.GetHerHim] is to present yourself for testing -- but would it be performed fairly?
Allow [doubting_priest.GetHerHim] to test me.
Let [doubting_priest.GetHerHim] doubt -- I do not care.

After a thorough questioning, [doubting_priest.GetTitledFirstName] is clearly convinced of your [Root.Religion.GetPietyName] and that your quest for sainthood is genuine. [doubting_priest.GetSheHeCap] begs your forgiveness, and suggests [doubting_priest.GetSheHe] will do whatever [doubting_priest.GetSheHe] can to help you.

After a thorough questioning, [doubting_priest.GetTitledFirstName] declares that you are no paragon of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith and certainly no living saint. You are almost certain [doubting_priest.GetSheHe] had decided the outcome long before meeting you, and nothing you said could have persuaded [doubting_priest.GetHerHim] otherwise.
Which of us truly lacks faith, I wonder?

As you continue your quest for sainthood, there are those who compliment your extreme [Root.Religion.GetPietyName] and dedication to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. Your name is constantly on the lips of the [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s during their sermons, as they hold you up as an example to others.

As you continue your quest for sainthood, there are those who compliment your dedication to knowledge and learning. You are a true [Root.Religion.GetName] scholar, they say, and the [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s hold you up as an example to all others.

As you continue your quest for sainthood, there are those who compliment your charisma and dedication to diplomacy. [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] has bestowed upon you a light that others admire, they say, and the [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s hold you up as an example to all others.

As you continue your quest for sainthood, there are those who compliment your martial prowess against the infidels. You are a true [Root.Religion.GetName] warrior, they say, and the [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s hold you up as an example to all others.

Your base lusts run contrary to everything a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith should possess, and you will never achieve true sainthood until you conquer them. Attempting to do so, however, will be far from easy.
I shall make the attempt!
No, this isn't worth it.

Your gluttonous nature runs contrary to the ideal a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith should aspire to, and you will never achieve true sainthood until you conquer it. Attempting to do so, however, will be far from easy.

Your greedy nature runs contrary to the ideal a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith should aspire to, and you will never achieve true sainthood until you conquer it. Attempting to do so, however, will be far from easy.

Your slothful nature runs contrary to the ideal a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith should aspire to, and you will never achieve true sainthood until you conquer it. Attempting to do so, however, will be far from easy.

Your envious nature runs contrary to the ideal a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith should aspire to, and you will never achieve true sainthood until you conquer it. Attempting to do so, however, will be far from easy.

Your cruel nature runs contrary to the ideal a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith should aspire to, and you will never achieve true sainthood until you conquer it. Attempting to do so, however, will be far from easy.

Your wrathful nature runs contrary to the ideal a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith should aspire to, and you will never achieve true sainthood until you conquer it. Attempting to do so, however, will be far from easy.

Pride is the deadliest sin, as it is the source of all others. If you truly aspire to be a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith, you will need to conquer this belief that you deserve more than others. You must prostrate yourself before [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and take what judgement He decrees.

Your deceitful nature runs contrary to the ideal a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith should aspire to, and you will never achieve true sainthood until you conquer it. Attempting to do so, however, will be far from easy.

You will never truly be a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith until you conquer your ambition. It comes from a sense of pride, at seeking to raise yourself above others rather than to accept what [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] has given you. To forget one's ambitions, however, is not an easy task.

Your arbitrary sense of justice runs contrary to the ideal a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith should aspire to, and you will never achieve true sainthood until you conquer it. Attempting to do so, however, will be far from easy.

For weeks you have tried to forget your lusts, to focus on chasteful thoughts and nothing else... but it has been no use. Not thinking such things leads to thinking of little else, until you are nearly mad from the attempt. You are cursed, and it seems nothing you do will change it.

For weeks you have nearly starved yourself, attempting to force yourself to be temperate as a good [Root.Religion.GetName] [Root.GetManWoman] ought to be... but it is no use. After a late-night binge in the kitchens, you have to admit that your will has been defeated by your appetite.

For weeks you have been trying to be charitable, giving coins away to those in need and considering what possessions you ought to offer as gifts. Each time, however, thoughts of what you have lost dominate your mind until it nearly drives you mad. The last time a beggar asked for alms you kicked him. Sadly, it is no use.

For weeks you have tried to be diligent, forcing yourself to attend to every important duty no matter how minor. It has done nothing but make you irritable, and you slowly find yourself making every excuse to do anything else. All you want to do now is sleep, and forget you ever wanted to be saintly. It's so much work!

For weeks you have tried to be kind, forcing yourself to think well of others and not envy the things they have which you do not. It is all just a facade, however. The spite built up inside until you lashed out at everyone who crossed your path, and now you just feel awful.

For weeks you have tried to be gentle and kind to everyone who crossed your path. Your edicts have been merciful, your sentences have been brief... but it's no use. It's as if not thinking cruel thoughts has made them ALL you can focus on. You need some time in the dungeons before you truly go mad.

For weeks you have tried to control your temper. You have been patient with everyone, so patient that your courtiers frequently marvel at this change of heart. But you despise them for admiring what you know are false words. After beating a page near to death for spilling your wine, you have to admit defeat.

For weeks you have tried to show humility. You have complimented those who didn't truly deserve it, gave others an opportunity to act even when you knew better, tried not to be angry when things didn't go your way... but it's no use. You don't feel any different. Indeed, perhaps you're not sure *how* not to be proud.

For weeks you have tried to be scrupulously honest, even regarding things that one really shouldn't be honest about. You heart isn't truly in it, however, and sometimes you find yourself winding your way around the truth like a snake. It's time to admit defeat.

For weeks you have done nothing... almost literally. You've made no plans, made no attempts to work towards your goals, and indeed have tried to forget about your goals completely. Being content just feels so unnatural, however. You can't push the ambitions from your mind, and finally have to admit defeat. It isn't working.

For weeks you have tried to be just in the way everyone expects. You've made every attempt to care about what's right and what's wrong, listened to your advisors, but it just seems so... pointless. You don't think you truly have a sense of justice, no matter how much you try. It's time to admit defeat.
I will try again -- I must!

For weeks you have dedicated yourself to prayer and your duties, attempting to put all lustful thoughts aside... and, to your surprise, it has worked. Perhaps whatever needs such thoughts served has been replaced by your love of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. Whatever the case, you now feel you can move forward, pure in deed as well as mind.

For weeks you have dedicated yourself to prayer and temperance, eating lightly and avoiding excess... and, to your surprise, it has worked. Your appetite has been replaced by a love of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and, while you may never be truly temperate, you can at least rest assured your gluttonous nature has been defeated.

For weeks you have dedicated yourself to prayer and charity... and, to your surprise, it has worked. Giving to others actually feels *good*. You never thought it would, really. No-one will ever accuse you of being truly charitable, but your overwhelming desire to accumulate things for yourself seems to have passed.

For weeks you have dedicated yourself to prayer and your duties... and, to your surprise, it has worked. You have never felt so alive and full of energy. Granted, it's difficult and you are exhausted all the time, but you look back on the way you were and can only shake your head at all the years wasted doing nothing useful.

For weeks you have dedicated yourself to prayer and kind thoughts... and, to your surprise, it has worked. All the spite you used to feel just seems to take so much *energy*, you now can't imagine why you did it. Nobody will accuse you of being kind, perhaps, but a little of your love of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] has now spread to others.

For weeks you have dedicated yourself to prayer and kind deeds... and, to your surprise, it has worked. Cruelty does not come quite so quickly as it used to, and it shocks you how good it feels to be generous from time to time. Perhaps such dark thoughts simply cannot survive in the light of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]'s love.

For weeks you have dedicated yourself to prayer and patience... and, to your surprise, it has worked. There have been no bouts of rage, no lashing out at anyone. When your old temper begins to rise, you think of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and it all seems to... melt away.

Humility does not come easy. For weeks you have dedicated yourself to prayer, and to thinking of others before yourself. To your surprise, doing so feels good. The way they smile is a reward in and of itself, even if you get nothing else out of it. Perhaps this is what [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]'s love truly means.

For weeks you have been nothing but scrupulously honest, dedicating yourself to prayer and avoiding twisty thoughts of intrigue. To your surprise, it has worked. It has become easier and easier just to speak your heart, and you find yourself regretting the fact you ever felt the need to deceive others at all.

Putting aside your ambitions has not been easy. For weeks you have dedicated yourself to prayer and made no plans, and for a while it made you mad to feel so idle... and then, one morning, you just let it go. [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] shall provide, or shall not. Perhaps it truly is that simple.

For weeks you have dedicated yourself to prayer, and to dealing with supplicants in the fairest manner possible. It all seemed like such pointless work, and so aggravating, until one day you realize right and wrong isn't so complicated. [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]'s love is justice, and knowing that makes it so much easier.
[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] has given me a gift, and I shall not squander it

There are those who question your mystic pursuits, wondering whether this is the act of a pious [Root.GetManWoman] of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] or the dabblings of a pagan. You insist that it is the former, but perhaps not everyone will see it that way.
Am I not a good [Root.Religion.GetGroupName]?

There are those who question your more... violent... interests, wondering whether these are the efforts of a zealous [Root.GetManWoman] of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] or the darker urges of a criminal. You insist that it is the former, but perhaps not everyone will see it that way.
I do what I do for [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!

As you continue your search for [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and saintly status, your chaste nature becomes better-known to those around you. [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitleCap]s in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] mention you in their sermons, saying that others should take their example from you and put aside their own lustful thoughts.
All should strive for virtue

As you continue your search for [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and saintly status, your vow of celibacy becomes better-known to those around you. [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitleCap]s in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] mention you in their sermons, saying that others should take their example from you and put aside their own lustful thoughts.

As you continue your search for [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and saintly status, your charitable nature becomes better-known to those around you. [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitleCap]s in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] mention you in their sermons, saying that others should take their example from you and put aside their own greed and envy.

As you continue your search for [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and saintly status, your kind nature becomes better-known to those around you. The people of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] consider you a generous ruler, untouched by the harsh world, and an example to others who seem to know only hate and cruelty.

As you continue your search for [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and saintly status, your humility becomes better-known to those around you. [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitleCap]s in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] mention you in their sermons, saying that others should take their example from you and put aside their own pride and concern for only themselves.

As you continue your search for [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and saintly status, your honest nature becomes better-known to those around you. Indeed, you recently told the truth to a visiting courtier when a lie would have served you far better... and the man was so impressed he told the tale far and wide.

As you continue your search for [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and saintly status, your sense of justice becomes better-known to those around you. The people of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] consider you a fair and wise ruler, trusting your edicts like they would almost no other, and an example to selfish rulers elsewhere.

As you continue your search for [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and saintly status, your devotion to theology has gained you a great deal of admiration. '[Root.GetTitledFirstName] is a true [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] scholar,' they say, and many eagerly await copies of your studies on [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and true faith.

There are those who have questioned the voice you claim to hear, suggesting it is not Jesus but a demon, or worse. Now it seems that tide has turned, and more people in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are realizing that perhaps you do have a connection to the Divine, that you have been touched by [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] Himself.
Jesus shall guide them, as he does me!
Through constant prayer and dedication to virtue, all the stress you feel has started to... simply melt away. Perhaps this is the peace a simpler life entails.
I shall renew my dedication to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!
It has taken time, but your devotion to prayer and virtue has lifted the dark clouds from your thoughts.

You have come to realize that your devotion to drink is, in itself, a form of gluttony that simply cannot be abided. The time for abstinence has come, as difficult as it will be on your system after so many years of excess.

You have devoted yourself for so long to your pursuit of saintly virtue, sometimes it feels as if you make almost no progress at all. But you are getting there, slow as the path might be. You can feel yourself drawing closer to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] with each passing day.
[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] forgive me my impatience!

It seems as if you have been walking the path to saintly virtue forever. Can it really be achieved, or is it all some lie peddled by the priests to the gullible? Doubt besets you, and you feel your resolve slipping despite your continued dedication to prayer.
I will not give up! I must not!

It is too much. Setback after setback has beset you, and it seems more and more unlikely you will ever achieve saintly virtue as you desire. It pains you to admit, but the time has come to give up on your ambition -- you are simply not the [Root.GetManWoman] of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] you'd hoped.

You have literally spent years on the path to saintly virtue, but you admit to yourself there are still flaws in your character that cannot be ignored. You are a sinner in your heart, and that baser part of you cannot be banished no matter how much you try. Sadly, the time has come to give up your ambition.
I simply cannot do it any longer...

You have spent years upon the path to saintly virtue, years spent banishing your inner demons and focusing exclusively on prayer and devotion to duty. The time has finally come to realize you have achieved your goal -- you are considered far and wide to be a [Root.GetManWoman] of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and a paragon of [Root.Religion.GetGroupName] piety.
I am but a servant of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
Expanded Milhemet Mitzvah

The Primordial Struggle

The very heartlands of the recently reformed [Root.Religion.GetName] faith are under siege by infidels! In response, the Great [Root.GetTitledName] has informed all [Root.Religion.GetName] [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s of [Root.GetPossPronoun] plans for a magnificent [Root.Religion.GetName] Pagan coalition to drive them back. In fact, all pagan heads of religion may now declare Great Holy Wars. This could be the beginning of unprecedented Heathen aggression.
As someone who is excommunicated by the Church, I have no choice but to comply with the Papal will when it comes to the distribution of the titles in the case of a victory in the Crusades.
column3: En tant que personne excommuniée par l'Église, je n'ai d'autre choix que de plier à la volonté du pape quand il s'agira de distribuer des titres en cas de victoire de la croisade.
column4: Als jemand, der von der Kirche exkommuniziert wird, habe ich keine andere Wahl, als dem päpstlichen Willen zu folgen, wenn es darum geht die Titel im Fall eines Sieges des Kreuzzugs zu verteilen.
column6: Como alguien que es excomulgado por la Iglesia, no tengo más remedio que cumplir con la voluntad papal cuando se trata de la distribución de los títulos en caso de una victoria en la cruzada.

column2:
[Root.GetTitledName],

Our crusade is meant for the righteous, not for those excommunicated by the Church, such as yourself. Know that as an excommunicated person, you will not be entitled to any monetary rewards from this crusade, and the Church will refuse to recognize any lands that you may obtain from this crusade.

However, I am not unreasonable. If you join and contribute to our cause despite no promises of material rewards, I will take this as a sign of your redemption in the eyes of the Church and lift your excommunication.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
column3:
[Root.GetTitledName],

Notre croisade est destinée aux justes, pas à ceux excommuniés par l'Église, comme vous. Sachez qu'en tant que personne excommuniée, vous n'aurez droit à aucune récompense monétaire de cette croisade, et l'Église refusera de reconnaître les terres que vous pourriez obtenir de cette croisade.

Cependant, je ne suis pas déraisonnable. Si vous vous joignez et contribuez à notre cause malgré aucune promesse de récompenses matérielles, je considérerai cela comme un signe de votre rédemption aux yeux de l'Église et je lèverai votre excommunication.

Signé,
[From.GetTitledName]
column4:
[Root.GetTitledName],

Unser Kreuzzug ist für die Gerechten, nicht für diejenigen, die von der Kirche exkommuniziert wurden, wie Sie. Wissen, dass Sie als Exkommunizierte keinen Anspruch auf finanzielle Belohnungen aus diesem Kreuzzug haben und die Kirche sich weigert, Länder anzuerkennen, die Sie aus diesem Kreuzzug erhalten würden.

Ich bin jedoch nicht unvernünftig. Wenn Sie sich unserer Sache anschließen und zu ihr beitragen, obwohl Sie keine materiellen Belohnungen versprechen, werde ich dies als Zeichen Ihrer Erlösung in den Augen der Kirche betrachten und Ihre Exkommunikation aufheben.

Gezeichnet,
[From.GetTitledName]
column6:
[Root.GetTitledName],

Nuestra cruzada es para los justos, no para los excomulgados por la Iglesia, como tú. Tenga en cuenta que, como persona excomulgada, no tendrá derecho a ninguna recompensa monetaria de esta cruzada, y la Iglesia se negará a reconocer las tierras que pueda obtener de esta cruzada.

Sin embargo, no soy irrazonable. Si te unes y contribuyes a nuestra causa a pesar de no haber promesas de recompensas materiales, tomaré esto como un signo de tu redención a los ojos de la Iglesia y levantaré tu excomunión.

Firmado,
[From.GetTitledName]

column2: My little [GetFromRelation], [From.GetFirstName], has an odd birthmark which closely matches that of [From.GetHerHis] grandfather, [From.Reincarnation.GetBestName]. Could he truly have been reborn as my [GetFromRelation] in this life?

My little [GetFromRelation], [From.GetFirstName], has an odd birthmark which closely matches that of [From.GetHerHis] grandmother, [From.Reincarnation.GetBestName]. Could she truly have been reborn as my [GetFromRelation] in this life?

My little [GetFromRelation], [From.GetFirstName], has an odd birthmark which closely matches that of [From.GetHerHis] great grandfather, [From.Reincarnation.GetBestName]. Could he truly have been reborn as my [GetFromRelation] in this life?

My little [GetFromRelation], [From.GetFirstName], has an odd birthmark which closely matches that of [From.GetHerHis] great grandmother, [From.Reincarnation.GetBestName]. Could she truly have been reborn as my [GetFromRelation] in this life?
The rain has been pouring down for days, it's almost impossible to travel the roads. Why does [Root.GetHighGodName] punish His faithful pilgrims so?
[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] is showing me the way!

As you walk around on this holy ground, you ponder the secrets and the essence of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. The teachings of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith have never felt more relevant to you than right now. Imagine the knowledge contained in the scriptures stored here!
The way to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] is through study.

The scriptures, the buildings, this holy ground, how it all moves my soul! I realize now that all my life up to this point has only been a preparation for this journey. How wondrous that the light of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] truly shines in me, a humble servant. From now on I shall always do His work.

The stories of other pilgrims all spoke of how impressive this place is. Now that you can see it with your own eyes, you can only join in their praise. You are glad that you came here, to one of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith's most holy places.

Near the holy sites, you hear rumors of a group of [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s with strange cures for diseases. Eagerly, you seek them out, hoping against hope that they may aid you. Once in their care you are fed strange potions, foods and herbs. You are unconscious or delirious during most of the process and remember few details, but at last you wake up to find that you have been miraculously healed of your ills.
[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]'s hand touched me and healed me!
These [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s really know their stuff.
Blasphemous fools! Do they not know that [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] speaks to them? How dare they throw you out of your own temple!
The [waldensian.GetName] faith says that relics are for fools, worthless trinkets who lure idolaters away from [waldensian.GetHighGodName]. What should be done with your family's relic?
Destroy it!
